This work is articulated in ten chapters, developed by medical oncologists and hospital pharmacists, covering various strategies and perspectives, such as the incorporation of PROMs and PREMs in cancer care, comprehensive care in cancer patients, and the approach to oncogeriatric patients, among others. The project, presented in a joint webinar by SEOM and SEFH, seeks to advance a comprehensive approach to the cancer patient, highlighting the importance of collaboration between Medical Oncology and Hospital Pharmacy to benefit the cancer patient.

title: SEOM pone en marcha un registro de portadores de variantes genéticas germinales en genes de predisposición al ...
summary: The Spanish Society of Medical Oncology (SEOM) has launched the CRECE registry (SEOM Hereditary Cancer Registry Consortium), a national registry of individuals carrying germline genetic variants in cancer predisposition genes. This registry will allow studies to better understand these syndromes in the Spanish population and develop more efficient programs for cancer prevention, early detection, and treatment. The registry coordinators, Ana Beatriz Sánchez Heras, Judith Balmaña, and Joan Brunet, highlight its importance in determining the clinical action of genetic diagnoses and their clinical utility. The registry will collect clinical and genetic data in a uniform manner and participate in international consortia for research on hereditary cancer. The main objectives include characterizing cancer predisposition syndromes and assessing the impact of their identification and follow-up.

title: La SEFH se una al Día de la Farmacia Hospitalaria promovido por la Asociación Europea de Farmac
summary: The Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SEFH) has joined the celebration of the first Hospital Pharmacy Day, promoted by the European Association of Hospital Pharmacists (EAHP). This day aims to raise awareness about the essential work of hospital pharmacists and the pharmacy team in European health systems, ensuring the proper functioning and safety and traceability of medicines. The initiative seeks to recognize and visualize the transformation and teamwork within pharmacy services, highlighting their role in patient care and in medication management. The SEFH has emphasized the importance of having well-funded hospital pharmacies prepared to face challenges such as drug shortages, underlining the need for greater recognition of this work.

title: La farmacia hospitalaria analiza su papel en el manejo de la cronicidad en población geriátrica | @diariofarma
summary: The Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SEFH), through the Cronos working group, celebrated the 2nd Day of Geriatrics and Hospital Pharmacy, highlighting the importance of multidisciplinary collaboration among pharmacists, geriatricians, and internists in managing chronicity in the geriatric population. With almost 90 registrants, the day addressed topics such as coordination between different levels of care, management of chronic diseases, therapeutic objectives in complex chronic patients, and practices of "not doing". Successful experiences of pharmacotherapeutic follow-up, approach to antibiotic optimization programs in elderly patients, management of heart failure with iSGLT-2, and particularities of geriatric patients with oncological processes were presented. Recommendations of "not doing", person-centered prescription, and care for older patients with HIV were also discussed, highlighting the need to evaluate pharmacotherapy in this population.

title: La sostenibilidad centra la reunión de la Sociedad Española de Farmacia Hospitalaria en Ponferrada
summary: The Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy organized a meeting in Ponferrada on April 12 and 13, focused on the sustainability of the hospital pharmaceutical service. The event was attended by more than a hundred professionals from Castilla y León and Galicia. During the meeting, three round tables and an opening conference by Nuria Iglesias, Deputy Director of Pharmaceutical Provision of the Pontevedra Health Area, were held, highlighting the importance of pharmacists in this field. The topics discussed ranged from the transition from coal to green hydrogen, environmental sustainability in pharmacy services, global health and cooperation experiences in Chad, to initiatives to reduce the carbon footprint of medications and legislation on recycling and destruction of these. The meeting also aligned with the Sustainable Development Goals to support the 2030 Agenda.

title: De los analgésicos a los antivíricos: el desabastecimiento estresa a las farmacias de los hospitales
summary: Hospitals' pharmacies are facing significant stress due to the shortage of medications ranging from analgesics to antivirals. Cecilia Martínez, president of the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SEFH), highlights the considerable impact on healthcare services, though the effect on patients is somewhat mitigated by the rapid search for alternatives. This issue has been ongoing for years, with pharmacy professionals actively seeking alternative suppliers, formulations, or even creating compound formulas to ensure patient care. In cases of severe shortages, the Spanish Agency for Medicines and Health Products (AEMPS) is involved to facilitate the import of foreign medications. The management of these shortages requires constant updating of information systems to ensure safe patient care. The causes of these shortages are multifaceted, including global market dynamics and availability of raw materials. Despite these challenges, hospital pharmacies work closely with healthcare institutions to manage and find solutions to these shortages efficiently.

title: Olga Delgado, la jefa del servicio de Farmacia del hospital de Son Espases, se jubila
summary: Olga Delgado, the head of the Pharmacy Department at Son Espases Hospital, is retiring after 12 years. Throughout her career, she has also served as the president of the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy. Delgado, who started her hospital pharmacy specialty in Bilbao and worked in Madrid before moving to Palma de Mallorca in 1994, has been recognized for her leadership in and outside her profession. She has been a member of the Health Advisory Committee and led several initiatives aimed at safe medication practices. Her work has significantly contributed to making the Pharmacy Service at the hospital a national and international reference point. Delgado's dedication has been celebrated by her colleagues and the health service's management as she steps down from her role.

title: Premio para el servicio de Farmacia del Virgen del Rocío por un estudio sobre el sesgo de género en ensayos clínicos
summary: The Pharmacy Service of the Virgen del Rocío University Hospital has been awarded by the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy during its 68th national congress in Bilbao, for a study on gender bias in clinical trials. This study, which was developed over five years, assessed gender bias in clinical trials of various drug groups, finding differences in the recruitment of women compared to men and a general absence of sex-based analysis. It also observed a progressive increase in women's representation according to the trial phase and less gender bias in studies funded by the pharmaceutical industry compared to independent ones. The research team mainly belongs to the Chronic-Pharma group of the Virgen del Rocío Pharmacy service and the Biomedicine Institute of Seville (IBIS), including collaborators from other services and departments.

title: Cecilia Martínez, farmacéutica del Gregorio Marañón, nueva presidenta de la SEFH
summary: Cecilia Martínez Fernández Llamazares, a pharmacist in charge of the Maternal-Child area at Gregorio Marañón Hospital, has been chosen as the new president of the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SEFH). With a Doctorate in Pharmacy from the University of Granada and a specialization in Hospital Pharmacy, Martínez also holds a diploma in Health Sciences Statistics from the Autonomous University of Barcelona. The SEFH, which has more than 4,500 members, represents almost all hospital pharmacy specialists in Spain. Martínez, who has made significant contributions to the field through her involvement in various committees and her broad research and teaching experience, will preside over the organization for the next four years. Her accomplishments include leading the accreditation process by the Joint Commission International (JCI) in the Maternal-Child area, participating in over 15 funded research projects, and writing more than 60 publications. Martínez has also been active in pediatric pharmacy and has served as an advisor to the Spanish Agency for Medicines and Health Products (AEMPS).

title: La Unidad de Farmacia del Hospital Universitario Poniente recibe la Certificación de Calidad Q-PEX - Noticias
summary: The Pharmacy Unit of the Hospital Universitario Poniente has received the Q-PEX Quality Certification, a national award for the quality of service to outpatient visitors. This certification, by the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy and supported by AbbVie, assesses the care for outpatients across quality standards in service, education, and research. The Hospital Universitario Poniente is one of the first in Spain to get this certification, ranking third in Andalusia and ninth nationally. The certification involves a self-evaluation, review of protocols, and an external audit for improvements. It aims to ensure high-quality care for outpatients amid challenges like aging and chronic diseases. Last year, the pharmacy's outpatient services helped over 2,700 patients with more than 11,600 prescriptions.

title: El grupo Gedefo de la SEFH celebra su IX reunión anual sobre farmacia oncológica
summary: The Oncology Pharmacy Working Group (Gedefo) of the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SEFH) held its IX annual meeting in Madrid, focusing on training, prevention, and the environment. During the event, the importance of social networks to connect healthcare professionals and provide information to patients was highlighted. Initiatives were presented to improve the training and integration of professionals and the care of oncology patients, including a training itinerary in onco-hematological pharmacy. The importance of intergenerational connection in hospital pharmacy teams was mentioned, and the Patient School was introduced, aimed at bringing hospital pharmacy closer to society. Also discussed were the prevention and management of toxicity in patients with liver damage, the complexity of clinical trials, the importance of vaccination in cancer patients, and the commitment of oncology pharmacy to sustainable development.

title: La SEFH se une al primer 'Día de la Farmacia Hospitalaria' promovido por la EAHP | @diariofarma
summary: The Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SEFH) has joined the celebration of the first Hospital Pharmacy Day, promoted by the European Association of Hospital Pharmacists (EAHP) on March 27, 2024. This day aims to raise awareness among the population about the importance of the work of hospital pharmacists and the team working in these services, highlighting their essential role in the proper functioning of health systems. The initiative seeks to recognize and make visible the work of all professionals involved in hospital pharmacy, including technicians, nurses, administrative staff, among others. The SEFH has actively participated in this day, launching a video and several hashtags on social networks to share testimonies of the different professional profiles. In addition, the importance of having well-funded and prepared hospital pharmacies to ensure better patient care and provide solutions in case of shortages of medicines or medical devices is highlighted.

title: El Hospital de Getafe obtiene una Certificación de Calidad por su programa de atención farmacéutica a pacientes ...
summary: The University Hospital of Getafe has received the Q-PEX Certification of medium level for its pharmaceutical care program for external patients, awarded by the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SEFH). This certification is a world pioneer and evaluates 118 indicators in areas such as context, leadership, planning, and continuous improvement, among others, with the aim of promoting best practices and increasing user satisfaction. The service has been recognized for its contribution to improving patient health through the dispensation and pharmacotherapeutic follow-up. In the last year, the program attended 21,219 consultations and made more than 120 home medication deliveries, standing out for its management strategy focused on continuous improvement and excellence in pharmaceutical care.

title: El Hospital Fundación Alcorcón, premiado por la creación de una Unidad de Atención Farmacéutica para los pacientes ...
summary: The Alcorcón Foundation Hospital was awarded at the LXVII National Congress of the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy for the creation of a Pharmaceutical Care Unit for patients in home hospitalization. This project, initiated in October 2021, allows offering the same pharmaceutical care to patients treated at home as to those admitted to the hospital. The initiative facilitates coordination and planning among different sections of the Pharmacy Service to meet the needs of the new unit, including the preparation of devices for the administration of treatments and the management of daily medication. The team behind the project includes researchers from the Pharmacy Area, the Home Hospitalization Unit, and the Economic-Financial Management of the hospital. This project was selected as one of the top three in the VI Call for SEFH/ROVI Awards for the Development of Hospital Pharmacy.

title: El crecimiento del tabaquismo diario marca la cita de Neumosur en Jaén
summary: The 50th edition of the Neumosur Congress, focusing on Pulmonology and Thoracic Surgery, was held in Jaén, gathering 300 attendees. The event, hosted at the former School of Teaching, was highlighted by discussions on the rise of daily smoking, especially among lower-income individuals and the active population. The Andalusian Health Survey indicated a decade-long increase in daily smoking prevalence. In response, Andalusia plans to amend its Addiction Law to create smoke-free spaces and ban vaping among minors. Catalina García, Health Counselor, emphasized the multidisciplinary approach to promoting healthy living environments and early risk factor management, including tobacco use. The congress also recognized professionals in lung transplantation, noting a 48% increase in 2023. The role of pulmonology and thoracic surgery specialists during the COVID-19 pandemic and their adaptation to 3D medical practices were acknowledged. The University of Jaén's commitment to improving medical training and the upcoming opening of new Health Sciences facilities were also highlighted.

title: Neumólogos andaluces a favor de endurecer la Ley anti-tabaco
summary: Andalusian pulmonologists support strengthening the anti-smoking law, as discussed on Onda Cero Sevilla. The Ministry of Health plans to present a draft to the Public Health Commission, proposing to ban smoking and vaping in certain outdoor community and social spaces, and in private spaces in the presence of minors, while also increasing the price of tobacco products. The draft is part of the "Comprehensive Plan for the Prevention and Control of Smoking 2024-2027," aiming to expand smoke-free areas and regulate new smoking devices like vapes and electronic cigarettes, which are seen as entry points to tobacco use, especially among the youth. The proposals also suggest raising the price of tobacco to €12 to act as a deterrent. The most controversial aspect is the potential ban on smoking in private spaces, such as inside a car with minors.

title: Frutas por cigarros en el Día Mundial Sin Tabaco en el Área Sanitaria Sur de Sevilla
summary: On World No Tobacco Day, the Southern Health Area of Seville organized a series of activities aimed at promoting tobacco cessation. These included informative booths with posters, cooximetry and spirometry tests, information on smoking cessation consultations, and sensitization and prevention workshops. A notable initiative was the exchange of fruit for cigarettes, highlighting an alternative approach to quitting smoking by encouraging better nutrition and physical exercise. The campaign also involved educational centers, social media, and the distribution of seed bookmarks by Neumosur. This effort aligns with the broader objectives of the Andalusian Comprehensive Tobacco Plan (PITA), which seeks to support smokers in quitting, reduce tobacco use, enhance professional training, foster research, promote smoke-free spaces, and prevent smoking initiation among adolescents.

title: AES y SCGS promoverán la formación y la investigación en economía de la salud | @diariofarma
hco: ASOCIACION DE ECONOMIA DE LA SALUD
summary: The Health Economics Association (AES) and the Catalan Society for Healthcare Management (SCGS) have signed a collaboration agreement to promote training and research in health economics. This partnership, effective for the next two years, aims to enhance educational and research fields, as well as quality assurance processes, benefiting both members and patients. The focus areas include healthcare based on value creation, system governance, management model analysis, future system sustainability and financing, and integrated care through health and social resources. Both entities will exchange relevant information and organize activities for mutual understanding, including the participation of designated specialists in national congresses and joint sessions. They will also develop joint research activities and conduct seminars, courses, and conferences on current topics of interest. This agreement is expected to facilitate knowledge sharing in health economics and management, with particular attention to management models, human resources, and organizational models.

title: Anna García-Altés: “La gripe satura los hospitales porque se insiste en tomar decisiones que cronifican los problemas del sistema sanitario”
hco: ASOCIACION DE ECONOMIA DE LA SALUD
summary: The president of the Health Economics Association, Anna García-Altés, criticizes the recurrent management of flu epidemics that saturate hospitals, attributing it to decisions that perpetuate the problems of the Spanish health system. She highlights the predictability of the flu and suggests a better allocation of resources, demystifying the idea that the solution lies solely in increasing the budget. García-Altés emphasizes the need to strengthen primary care, making it more attractive to professionals and educating the public about self-care and the proper use of health resources, such as electronic consultations and the 061 telephone line. She also advocates for the importance of flu vaccination and reducing unnecessary administrative tasks for medical staff, pointing to a more efficient management of the health system that avoids hospital saturation.

title: La AES, incluida en la revisión de los IPT | @diariofarma
hco: ASOCIACION DE ECONOMIA DE LA SALUD
summary: The Spanish Association of Health Economics (AES) has begun to actively participate in the Therapeutic Positioning Reports (IPT) of the National Health System, as announced by Ana García-Altés, president of the association. This collaboration marks an effort to integrate the economic perspective into the evaluation of medicines in Spain, thus contributing to the improvement of health and health services through a culture of evaluation. The AES will provide pharmacoeconomic analysis, economic evaluations, and budget impact assessments to the IPTs, a management tool created in 2013 to assess the therapeutic efficacy and safety of medicines before their commercialization. This initiative seeks to strengthen decisions on drug pricing and reimbursement in Spain, based on evidence and contributing to the scientific rigor of the IPTs.

title: Actualidad • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The text outlines the utilization of cookies on the Fundació Puigvert website, detailing their role in customizing content, analyzing traffic, and facilitating information sharing with social networks, advertisers, and analytics partners. It divides cookies into categories such as necessary, preferences, statistics, and marketing, with each category serving distinct purposes like enabling essential website functions, storing user preferences, collecting data on visitor interactions anonymously, and presenting personalized advertisements, respectively. Furthermore, it discusses Fundació Puigvert's collaboration with various organizations, underscoring progress in science and technology, healthcare information, and the opening of new facilities designed to improve the well-being of patients and staff. Key areas of focus include robotic surgery, the early detection and comprehensive treatment of chronic kidney disease, and support for individuals with cancer. The text also highlights the institution's educational and research endeavors, showcasing its dedication to medical, scientific, and academic progress.

title: El ICF y BBVA financian con 4,8 millones la remodelación del hospital de la Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Catalan Institute of Finance (ICF) and BBVA have agreed to jointly finance with 4.8 million euros the improvement and remodeling works of the Fundació Puigvert hospital, specialized in urology, nephrology, andrology, and reproductive medicine. This financing is part of a continuous support of two decades to the institution, highlighting the inauguration of the Triangle building in 2011, which connected and expanded the existing facilities. The CEO of ICF, Vanessa Servera, and the regional director of BBVA in Catalonia, Francisco Pla, emphasized the importance of collaborating on projects that improve the quality of life and well-being of patients. Ramon Massaguer, general director of the Fundació Puigvert, emphasized the need for constant modernization of hospital facilities to adapt to care needs and ensure the safety and well-being of patients.

title: Enfermería acompaña antes, durante y después de la intervención quirúrgica • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Nursing team at Fundación Puigvert provides extensive support before, during, and after surgery through an educational video. This effort seeks to reduce patient anxieties and help them understand the procedure, making sure they come to the hospital ready and relaxed. With a focus on kidney, urogenital, and reproductive diseases, the nurses have more than 60 years of experience in caring for patients, highlighting their dedication to patient health and peace of mind.

title: Álvaro Vives Suñé: "No vamos a conseguir mucho más uso del preservativo”
summary: Álvaro Vives Suñé, head of the sexually transmitted infections (STI) unit at the Fundació Puigvert, emphasizes prevention and regular check-ups as key strategies to combat the rising tide of STIs. He advocates for the vaccination of children against the human papillomavirus (HPV), highlighting its role in preventing cancers associated with the virus, such as cervical cancer. Despite the vaccine's cost, Vives argues for its value in potentially eradicating cervical cancer within 20-30 years and significantly reducing other HPV-related cancers over time. He points out the challenges in global vaccination efforts, especially in countries that do not systematically vaccinate women, let alone men. Vives also discusses the transmission of HPV, noting that it can occur through contact without penetration and that improper use of condoms can lead to infection. He stresses the importance of education and awareness in preventing STIs, advocating for more comprehensive sexual education in schools to address misinformation and the lack of awareness about sexual health.

title: Docencia universitaria y ciclos formativos • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The text discusses the educational and training programs offered by Fundació Puigvert, highlighting its commitment to higher education through partnerships with public and private universities. It is affiliated with the Faculty of Medicine at the Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona (UAB) and the Universitat de Vic - UCC, providing degree and postgraduate studies, including a pioneering Master's program in Clinical Andrology in Spain. The foundation also offers vocational training for healthcare professionals in various specialties. Additionally, it details the use of cookies on its website for personalizing content, analyzing traffic, and sharing information with social media, advertising, and web analysis partners. The text includes technical information about the types of cookies used and their purposes, ranging from necessary, preferences, statistics, to marketing cookies, and how users can manage their consent.

title: #SomPuigvert • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Puigvert Foundation, established in 1961 by Professor Antoni Puigvert i Gorro, is a monographic hospital specializing in urology, nephrology, andrology, and reproductive medicine. It operates as a private, non-profit university hospital dedicated to the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of pathologies and dysfunctions of the urinary system, kidneys, male genital organs, and male and female reproductive functions. With more than 60 years of history, it has achieved numerous milestones in medicine and its specialty, standing out as the first Nephrology Service in Spain, a pioneer in Andrology, living donor kidney transplant, and robotic surgery with the DaVinci robot. The Foundation has a Strategic Plan 2021-2025 to continue evolving and specializing in areas such as robotic surgery, rare kidney diseases, urinary incontinence, lithiasis, congenital urogenital malformations, sexual health, male infertility, and kidney transplant.

title: Investigación • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Puigvert Foundation, specialized in urology, nephrology, andrology, and assisted reproduction, is dedicated to patient-centered research to improve quality of life and survival. Its research and development include innovation and public participation, covering research lines in urological, renal, reproductive pathologies, and rare diseases. The Foundation integrates research with care and teaching, having three own research groups at the Institut d’Investigació Biomèdica Sant Pau. In addition, it collaborates with national and international entities in the generation and dissemination of scientific knowledge. The Puigvert Foundation also focuses on clinical and translational research, being a pioneer in the development of new technologies and surgical techniques. Its Research Support Area, created in 2019, facilitates the conduct of studies and project management.

title: Docencia y formación • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Puigvert Foundation, recognized since 1967 for its teaching vocation in Health Sciences, offers a wide range of educational programs in Urology, Nephrology, Andrology, Reproductive Medicine, and cross-sectional areas such as Anesthesiology and Nursing. It collaborates with public and private universities, providing teaching in undergraduate, postgraduate, and higher vocational training courses. The Foundation is accredited to train specialists through the National Health System, offering MIR positions in urology and nephrology. Annually, it organizes training activities adapted to new technologies and the needs of the sector. Additionally, it has been recognized as a European center of excellence in resident training by the European Board of Urology, standing out for meeting high educational and infrastructure standards. It also offers a Master's in Clinical Andrology, a pioneer in Spain, which prepares students for the accreditation exam of the European Academy of Andrology.

title: Política de Privacidad • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Privacy Policy of the Fundació Puigvert details how cookies and personal data of users on its website are used. Cookies are used to personalize content, ads, offer social network functionalities, and analyze traffic, sharing usage information with social network partners, advertising, and web analysis. Various types of cookies are specified: necessary for navigation and functionality of the site, preference cookies to remember user settings, statistical cookies to understand user interaction with the site, and marketing cookies to track visitors and display relevant ads. The policy also addresses the processing of personal data, focusing on commercial management, sending communications, providing services, and profile analysis. It mentions the legal basis for processing, the rights of users regarding their data, security measures to protect such data, and the information collected from users. Finally, information about changes to the policy, revocability of consent, and applicable legislation is included.

title: La Fundació Puigvert inaugura cafetería para pacientes y acompañantes • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Puigvert Foundation has inaugurated a new cafeteria for patients, relatives, companions, and hospital professionals, under the Livingfood concept, focused on health and well-being. This space, managed by Aramark, is located in the Triangle building of the Foundation, in Barcelona, and offers views of the Sant Pau Modernist Precinct. The cafeteria has an indoor area and a large 240 m² outdoor terrace, redesigned by architects Josep Lluís Cabré-Verdiell and Bianca Lázaro, making use of the original triangle-shaped structure. The interior design, aimed at promoting health and well-being, includes Italian design furniture and has chosen materials such as glass, stainless steel, and concrete. The gastronomic offer, led by executive chef Gorka Barahona, includes salads, sandwiches, juices, and coffees, with opening hours from Monday to Friday from 7:30 to 18:30, and adjustments in August. The use of healthy ingredients and biodegradable or compostable materials for take away is emphasized.

title: Sala de prensa • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Puigvert Foundation uses cookies to personalize content, ads, offer social media features, and analyze traffic, sharing data with social media, advertising, and web analysis partners. Cookies are classified as necessary, preference, statistics, and marketing, and are essential for the functioning of the page. Additionally, the foundation aims to be a source of rigorous and accessible information in urology, nephrology, andrology, and reproductive medicine, maintaining its leadership as a reference hospital center. The Puigvert Foundation is involved in communication and training, excelling in innovation and future vision. Hospital improvement projects have been carried out with funding of 4.8 million euros, and emphasis is placed on the prevention and early diagnosis of rare diseases. Moreover, a reference unit in complex urethral surgery and advances in preimplantation genetic diagnosis, among other achievements, have been accomplished.

title: Cirugía Robótica • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Puigvert Foundation, specialized in Urology, Nephrology, Andrology, and Reproductive Medicine, is a leader in Spain in the robotization of surgery, with half of its surgical block robotized. Since the introduction of the Da Vinci surgical system in 2005, the foundation has moved towards the use of Medtronic's HUGO surgical robot, the most advanced to date, allowing for more precise and safer operations. This focus on robotic surgery minimizes incisions, anesthesia, blood loss, post-surgical pain, scarring, and the risk of infections. The Puigvert Foundation has established itself as a benchmark in uro-oncology, benefiting from experience and training in the use of advanced technology to improve surgical outcomes and patient recovery. In addition, the foundation is committed to teaching and research, offering specialized training in robotic surgery and participating in international studies to improve surgical practices.

title: Calidad • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The Puigvert Foundation, specialized in urology, nephrology, and reproductive medicine, uses cookies on its website to personalize content, ads, provide social media features, and analyze traffic, sharing information with social media, advertising, and analysis partners. Cookies are classified as necessary, preference, statistical, and marketing, with the necessary ones being essential for navigation and site functionality. The Foundation has received multiple accreditations and awards that endorse its excellence in quality and safety in both healthcare and non-healthcare processes. Additionally, it is recognized for its teaching and research work, having authorizations to perform live donor and cross kidney transplants, being a national and international reference center in various specialties. It participates in the Public Use Hospital Network and is affiliated with the Autonomous University of Barcelona for undergraduate and postgraduate teaching.

title: Supraespecialización • Fundació Puigvert
summary: The text provides an overview of the Fundació Puigvert's website, highlighting its use of cookies for personalizing content, ads, social media functions, and web traffic analysis. It shares web usage information with social media, advertising, and web analytics partners. The site categorizes cookies into necessary, preferences, statistics, and marketing types, detailing their purposes and functionalities. It also mentions the ability to change or withdraw cookie consent at any time. Furthermore, the text outlines the Fundació Puigvert's specialized medical and surgical services in areas like robotic surgery, rare renal diseases, urinary incontinence, lithiasis, congenital urogenital malformations, male sexual health and infertility, and renal transplantation. It emphasizes the foundation's role as a reference center in urology and nephrology, pioneering in robotic surgery and other advanced treatments. Additionally, it covers the foundation's educational and research activities, including university teaching, specialized health training (MIR), and ongoing research projects. Lastly, it provides administrative details about the foundation, including its legal and transparency policies, privacy policy, and contact information.

title: Las XIII Jornadas de SEDISA pondrán el foco en el compromiso sostenible y la transformación tecnológica
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE DIRECTIVOS DE LA SALUDSEDISA
summary: The XIII National Conference of the Spanish Society of Health Managers (SEDISA) will focus on sustainable commitment and technological transformation, taking place on May 22, 23, and 24 in Valencia at the Norman Foster-designed Congress Palace, awarded as the Best Congress Palace in the World in 2018 and 2010. This event will highlight the importance of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and feature a fully sustainable approach, including local seasonal catering and transportation options that minimize carbon footprint. Technological advancements, particularly in artificial intelligence (AI), will be a key topic, emphasizing its role in diagnostics and health management. The conference will address six main concepts: One Health, Global Health, Strategies, Data, Talent, and Digital Transformation and Robotics, aiming to discuss and promote advancements in crucial health areas. The event is supported by 72 scientific societies and health sector entities, focusing on the evolution of Health Management in terms of talent within Organizations.

title: La profesionalización de los directivos de la salud y la gestión sanitaria en el marco político actual
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE DIRECTIVOS DE LA SALUDSEDISA
summary: The professionalization of health managers and health management is essential to improve the quality and sustainability of the health system, facing challenges such as financing, innovation, and outcome evaluation. José Soto Bonel, president of the Spanish Society of Health Managers, highlights the need for specific training and experience for these managers. Elections are key moments for the advancement of this professionalization, which must be supported by all political and health sectors. Depoliticization and transparency in appointments and dismissals are fundamental, as is an objective evaluation based on results. Professionalization not only improves health management but is crucial for Value-Based Health Management, focused on care quality and efficiency. The challenge is to extend this professionalization in both the private and public sectors, ensuring the selection and development of managers under principles of equality, merit, and capacity.

title: Directivos de Osakidetza admiten que el sistema sanitario «necesita cambios»
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE DIRECTIVOS DE LA SALUDSEDISA
summary: Osakidetza executives, Maribel Romo and Jon Guajardo, acknowledge that the healthcare system needs adjustments to better respond to the needs of an aging society. They emphasize that while the system is not at risk of disappearing, it does require changes to adapt to the current societal health demands, which have evolved significantly from two or three decades ago.

title: Arranca el XV Curso de Gestión de Proyectos
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE DIRECTIVOS DE LA SALUDSEDISA
summary: The XV Project Management Course has commenced, organized by the Spanish Society of Health Managers (Sedisa) in collaboration with Janssen. The event, taking place at the Euroforum Infantes in El Escorial, Spain, has gathered over 200 health executives from across the country. Accredited with 2 ECTS credits by the European University, the course was inaugurated by Fernando Prados, Deputy Minister of Health of the Community of Madrid. The program aims to address current and innovative topics in health management, focusing on the future of healthcare management, new management models, the future of health professions, Corporate Social Responsibility, access to innovation, the new professional-patient relationship, and innovation in health management. Esteemed speakers like journalist Vicente Vallés and various experts will cover these themes. The course emphasizes teamwork and project development, facilitating the practical application of theoretical knowledge.

title: Los directores gerentes de los hospitales españoles, ¿elegidos por los políticos?
hco: SOCIEDAD ESPAÑOLA DE DIRECTIVOS DE LA SALUDSEDISA
summary: In Spain, 54% of public hospital managing directors are appointed directly by politicians after elections, while 10% are selected through public competitions and 27% through internal selection processes. This phenomenon is especially observed after the 28M elections, which led to numerous appointments. Some regions, like Madrid and Cantabria, have adopted laws to promote the professionalization of these positions through public competitions. The managing directors, mostly men with a background in Medicine, are responsible for the comprehensive management of the hospitals. Despite the trend towards professionalization, some regions continue the practice of direct appointment by politicians. The structure and management of hospitals have remained constant since 1987, emphasizing the need for professional managers in the health sector.

title: El proyecto de biopsia virtual del aragonés Schuhmacher recibe la XVII Beca GEIS José María Buesa
summary: The "Virtual Biopsy" project, led by the Aragonese scientist Alberto Jiménez Schuhmacher, has been awarded the XVII GEIS José María Buesa Scholarship, endowed with 16,000 euros. This project, developed at the Aragon Agency for Research and Development (Araid) Foundation, focuses on the advancement of clinical therapeutics and the understanding of sarcomas. Specifically, it seeks to create new diagnostic methods for osteosarcoma, the most common type of bone tumor in children and adolescents, through the use of modified antibodies to detect specific biomarkers. This approach could guide the treatment of some patients with this disease. The research team is multidisciplinary, including collaborators from various hospitals and universities, highlighting the commitment to innovative and potentially transformative research in the field of sarcomas.

title: El Grupo Español de Investigación en Sarcomas publica la primera guía sobre sarcomas uterinos
summary: The Spanish Group for Sarcoma Research (GEIS) has published the first Spanish guide on uterine sarcomas in the journal Ther Adv Med Oncol. This guide addresses the need for updated information and dissemination of new clinical studies regarding this rare type of tumor, diagnosed in only 2-3 cases per 100,000 inhabitants per year in Spain. The guide, a collaborative effort by experts from ten institutions, was coordinated by Drs. José Alejandro Pérez Fidalgo from INCLIVA and Ana Sebio from the Biomedical Research Institute of Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau–IIB Sant Pau in Barcelona. It aims to aid in the clinical management of uterine sarcomas, which are challenging due to their diagnostic complexity and limited therapeutic options. The guide emphasizes the importance of surgical treatment and offers recommendations for postoperative management, acknowledging the challenges in decision-making due to the limited positive outcomes from adjuvant chemotherapy and radiotherapy studies. It also reviews evidence for advanced disease treatment, including the potential benefits of trabectedin with doxorubicin, as shown in the LMS-04 trial.

title: Claudia Valverde, investigadora en sarcomas: «Los tratamientos largos y pesados son los que mejoran la supervivencia»
summary: Claudia Valverde, president of the Spanish Sarcoma Research Group, discusses the challenges and advancements in sarcoma research, a rare cancer affecting less than five in 100,000 people. Sarcomas, which can develop in bones or soft tissues like muscles or nerves, represent at most 1% of all diagnosed tumors annually, yet there are around 150 recognized subtypes by the World Health Organization. The rarity and diversity of sarcomas make research both challenging and essential. Most sarcomas have unknown causes, with a few linked to factors like radiation therapy in breast cancer patients or genetic components in young patients. Treatment primarily involves surgery, with chemotherapy and radiotherapy as additional options depending on the sarcoma type. Advances in targeted therapies and efforts to improve early diagnosis are ongoing, with the goal of enhancing survival rates and quality of life for patients.

title: Sarcomas en el útero, el riesgo de confundirlos con miomas
summary: Sarcomas in the uterus can be easily confused with fibroids, particularly in their early stages, warns oncologist and clinical researcher Ricardo Cubedo from the Puerta de Hierro University Hospital in Madrid. On International Sarcoma Day, he emphasized the importance of vigilance when diagnosing uterine fibroids due to the potential, albeit rare, risk of sarcoma. Sarcomas are a type of cancer that can occur in both bones and soft parts of the body, including the uterus, and are characterized by their aggressive growth, pain, and bleeding, distinguishing them from the typically slow-growing and benign fibroids. The Spanish Group for Sarcoma Research (GEIS) has published the first Spanish guide on uterine sarcomas to address the need for updated clinical studies and information dissemination about these rare tumors, which are diagnosed in only 2 to 3 cases per 100,000 inhabitants per year in Spain. The guide aims to improve the clinical management of uterine sarcomas, which presents significant challenges due to their rarity, diagnostic complexity, and limited therapeutic options.

title: Uno de cada dos mayores de 65 años de Zamora sufrirá una enfermedad reumática
summary: Half of the population over 65 years old in Zamora will suffer from a rheumatic disease, with an increase in autoimmune pathologies noted since the coronavirus pandemic. This was highlighted during the II Jornadas de Zamora Jornadas de Reumatología, which focused on immunomediated diseases in older adults and attracted around 60 professionals from across Spain. The prevalence of these conditions in Zamora, a city with a significant elderly population, underscores the importance of such events. These diseases, often diagnosed in individuals in their 40s or 50s, can become more complex with age due to the accumulation of other conditions like hypertension or diabetes. Rheumatology deals with diseases of the connective tissue affecting various organs and systems, requiring careful management and sometimes aggressive treatments. The conference also highlighted the local healthcare system's capacity to manage these conditions, with a controlled waiting list and five rheumatologists on staff.

title: La Sociedad Española del Dolor y la Fundación Grünenthal premian a la investigadora de la Universidad de Granada María del Carmen Ruiz Cantero
summary: María del Carmen Ruiz Cantero, a researcher from the University of Granada, has been awarded the Juan Antonio Micó Prize for Pain Research 2023 by the Spanish Pain Society and the Grünenthal Foundation. This recognition is for her doctoral thesis on "Peripheral sigma-1 receptors: at the interface between nociceptor sensitization and immune cells." Her work, conducted at the Department of Pharmacology and the Biomedical Research Center of the University of Granada, under the guidance of Professors Enrique J. Cobos del Moral and José Manuel Baeyens Cabrera, focuses on the role of sigma-1 receptors in chronic pain's pathophysiology. Ruiz Cantero's research suggests that blocking sigma-1 receptors could increase endogenous pain relief mechanisms and reduce communication between sensory neurons and immune cells, potentially leading to the development of new analgesics for chronic pain treatment. She is currently a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Barcelona.

title: Cannabis medicinal: la Sociedad Española del Dolor, optimista por el compromiso de Sanidad para retomar su regulación
summary: Spain is on the brink of regulating medicinal cannabis, following a commitment from the Ministry of Health, as sources disclosed to Europa Press. This advancement is greatly appreciated by the medical community, including the Spanish Pain Society (SED), which views it as a major progress for patients suffering from chronic neuropathic pain or cancer pain, among other conditions. The regulation process gained momentum after a draft ministerial order was prepared by the State Agency for Medicines and Health Products (AEMPS) and is now under the supervision of Mónica García's department. This initiative followed a congressional subcommittee on medicinal cannabis's decision in June 2022 to regulate its therapeutic use. The AEMPS was charged with implementing the recommendations within six months, with the goal of making medicinal cannabis available through pharmacies. The forthcoming regulation, expected in the next few months, is anticipated to be a significant breakthrough in providing additional therapeutic options for patients.

title: "El abordaje multidisciplinar y contar con el paciente son fundamentales en la investigación y abordaje del dolor"
summary: The text highlights the importance of a multidisciplinary approach and patient involvement in the research and management of pain, as emphasized by the Spanish Pain Society (SED). Chronic pain, lasting more than 3 months, is a significant health issue that affects patients' nervous systems, potentially leading to depression and anxiety. Current treatments include conventional analgesics and emerging therapies like medicinal cannabinoids. Psychological and psychiatric evaluations, cognitive-behavioral therapies, and physiotherapy are crucial in managing chronic pain. Interventionist techniques and nerve stimulation are also mentioned as effective strategies. The text underscores the need for improved access to pain units, better coordination among healthcare providers, and enhanced training and research in pain management. The SED is committed to advancing research, training, and international collaboration to improve the quality of life for people with chronic pain.

title: "Si no se fortalece la AP, el dolor va a estar mal tratado siempre"
summary: If Primary Care (PC) is not strengthened, pain management will always be inadequate, according to María Madariaga and Carlos Goicoechea of the Spanish Pain Society. They highlight the difference between chronic and acute pain, and the need for a multidisciplinary approach to diagnosis and treatment. The lack of training in PC and the fragmentation of the health system complicate pain management, which should be addressed from various specialties. The chronic pain barometer in Spain 2022 reveals that 25.9% of the adult population suffers from chronic pain, highlighting the need to improve training and access to appropriate treatments. Pain units, often saturated, demonstrate the need to strengthen PC for initial pain management, reserving specialized units for complex cases. Continuous training and accreditation of professionals in pain management are essential to improve care and the quality of life of patients.

title: Dolor crónico: un dolor persistente difícil de entender si no se padece
summary: Chronic pain affects one in four Spaniards, about 26% of the population, a figure that is increasing according to the Chronic Pain Barometer in Spain. Chronic pain is defined as pain that is continuous for more than four days a week and lasts for more than three months. It affects both men and women, with a higher incidence in women, and can occur in various body parts, leading to disabling consequences. Dr. María Madariaga, an anesthesiologist and pain specialist, notes that although chronic pain is often associated with degenerative pain in older individuals, it predominantly affects people around the age of 50. The social understanding of chronic pain is limited because it is not externally visible. The most common sources of chronic pain are musculoskeletal, joint, and mechanical origins, often starting with inflammation. It typically affects major joints, especially the lumbar region of the spine and knees. Chronic pain can be treated either as a symptom, which is successful when the injury heals, or as a chronic disease, which becomes more complex when it affects the nervous system. Primary chronic pain, intense, chronic, and generalized without a specific injury, is the most prevalent among the population.

title: La Sociedad Española del Dolor pide una ley del cannabis | @diariofarma
summary: The Spanish Pain Society (SED) has requested the creation of a law to regulate the use of cannabis for the treatment of neuropathic, refractory, and oncologic chronic pain. During its XIX National Congress, experts highlighted the importance of therapeutic cannabis use being supervised by professionals specialized in pain treatment and that patients receive adequate information about possible side effects and risks. Currently, the regulation of cannabis in Spain has not significantly advanced, with the Spanish Agency for Medicines and Health Products (Aemps) yet to issue recommendations on its use as a medicine. Jesús de Santiago, coordinator of the SED's Cannabinoids Group, argues that cannabis should also be indicated for other types of refractory chronic pain, such as fibromyalgia, although clinical guidelines recommend its use in individual therapeutic trials and not in a generalized manner.

title: El estrecho vínculo entre emoción y dolor
summary: The text discusses the strong link between emotion and pain, emphasizing that chronic pain involves the same brain circuits and functions as emotion processing, learning, avoidance, and reward. Dr. María Madariaga, president of the Spanish Pain Society (SED), and psychiatrist Dr. Martín L. Vargas highlight that half of chronic pain patients experience depression, underscoring the emotional impact of pain. At the #TuDolorImporta event, organized by SED and supported by various organizations, professionals and patients discussed this connection. Patients shared how art helps them reconnect with themselves, overcoming the emotional and physical challenges of chronic pain. The discussions also covered the importance of early attention to chronic pain in vulnerable groups and the need for specific training in pain management in health science degrees. The event stressed the necessity of an integrated approach to patient care, considering both the physical and emotional aspects of pain, and called for a health system adapted to the reality of patients' experiences.

title: Un 25% de mujeres y un 17% de hombres sufren dolor pélvico crónico
summary: 25% of women and 17% of men suffer from chronic pelvic pain, according to the Spanish Pain Society (SED). The prevalence of this pain varies, affecting between 6.4% and 25.4% of women and between 2% and 17% of men, although it is estimated that between 8% and 12% of men will experience chronic pelvic pain at some point. The SED organized a Summer Course at the Complutense University of Madrid titled "Let's Talk About Chronic Pelvic Pain: It's Not a Matter of Gender," highlighting that addressing this pain requires a multidisciplinary perspective, involving researchers, clinicians, physiotherapists, psychologists, among others, because it can manifest as gynecological, sexual, intestinal, or pelvic floor dysfunctions.

title: Dr. Rodrigo García-Baquero: “Muchos problemas de salud empiezan dando la cara en la función sexual”
summary: Dr. Rodrigo García-Baquero, a specialist in Urology and Andrology at the Hospital Universitario Puerta del Mar in Cádiz and a spokesperson for the Spanish Urology Association, highlights the significance of sexual function as a marker of men's underlying health conditions. Variations in sexual desire, orgasm, ejaculation, and arousal could indicate health issues. A decrease in libido might stem from organic reasons like lower testosterone levels due to obesity, poor cardiovascular health, or aging, as well as psychological factors, such as the effects of medications. Erectile dysfunction (ED) is often associated with cardiovascular problems and can signal conditions like hypertension, diabetes, or high cholesterol. The link between ED and diabetes, which impacts vascular function and nerve transmission necessary for an erection, is well-established. Moreover, sexual issues can also suggest neurological disorders or benign prostatic hyperplasia. García-Baquero emphasizes the vital role of urologists in identifying these conditions through sexual health, underlining the importance of seeking specialist advice for accurate diagnosis and treatment.

title: La AEU celebra la Reunión Nacional del Grupo de Urología Funcional, Femenina y Urodinámica
summary: The Spanish Association of Urology (AEU) will celebrate the XXVIII Meeting of the Group of Functional, Female Urology and Urodynamics (GUFFU) on May 16 and 17 at the Girona Congress Palace. The event will gather around 150 urologists to share knowledge, experiences, and advancements in the field. The program will include lectures and practical workshops on relevant topics such as urinary incontinence, overactive bladder, and surgeries. The workshops will be led by reference professors and will address minimally invasive therapy techniques for benign prostatic hyperplasia, among others. Additionally, informative activities have been organized for the general public about these pathologies.

title: Más de un centenar de urólogos de todo el país se reúnen en Albacete para compartir experiencias y conocimientos ...
summary: More than a hundred urologists from across Spain gathered in Albacete to share experiences and knowledge on kidney transplantation during the World Kidney Day. The XXXI National Meeting of the Kidney Transplant Group of the Spanish Urology Association, held for the first time in Castilla-La Mancha, was inaugurated by the Director-General of Healthcare Assistance of SESCAM, Ibrahim Hernández. The event highlighted the importance of these meetings for exchanging information on donation and transplantation, and for the practical training of surgeons. In the early months of 2024, Castilla-La Mancha performed 27 kidney transplants. The meeting also emphasized the region's commitment to professional training in kidney transplantation, including courses and advanced simulation practices. Since the initiation of the kidney transplant program in 2003, over 1,300 kidney transplants have been performed in the region. Additionally, a program for normothermic abdominal preservation for controlled asystole donation was mentioned, which has significantly increased the donation rates.

title: “Todavía hay varones con disfunción eréctil que no consultan al urólogo por vergüenza”
summary: Many men with erectile dysfunction (ED) still avoid seeing a urologist due to embarrassment, although the number is decreasing, according to Dr. Rodrigo García-Baquero of the Spanish Association of Urology (AEU). Sexual issues are often taboo, especially with strong male stereotypes. However, easier access to information online and campaigns aimed at women are encouraging men to seek help more often and sooner. ED, the inability to get or keep an erection, can lead men to use ineffective or harmful home remedies or online products. It's important for men to stay away from fake experts and dubious products, as ED can be an early warning sign of serious illnesses like diabetes. The condition, mainly caused by blood vessel problems, can also indicate cardiovascular risks. A thorough health check is crucial, as ED could point to more serious underlying issues. Treatment should be approached carefully, particularly because psychological factors can worsen ED.

title: Albacete reúne a más de un centenar de urólogos
summary: Albacete hosted the 31st National Meeting of the Transplant Group of the Spanish Association of Urology, attended by over a hundred urologists. This event, celebrated at the Fábrica de Harinas in Albacete, was highlighted by Dr. Antonio Salinas, head of the Urology Service at the University Hospital Complex of Albacete, as a significant achievement, especially following the 20th anniversary of the hospital as a transplant center. The meeting focused on discussing various aspects of kidney transplantation from living donors, a program that Albacete initiated years ago. Dr. Salinas emphasized the importance of training in renal transplantation for professionals from their residency stage, including national reference training courses that improve skills through simulation and animal models. Additionally, Dr. Mireia Musquera, coordinator of the Renal Transplant Work Group, underlined the crucial role of simulation in urology for continuous skill improvement. A practical workshop on kidney transplantation was also conducted to intensively develop implantation techniques using simulation models, benefiting 40 students guided by expert professors in renal transplantation.

title: La donación en asistolia se duplica y representa casi el 40%
summary: Asystole donation in Castilla-La Mancha has increased significantly, now representing almost 40% of donations, a growth from the previous 19%. This increase was highlighted at the XXXI National Meeting of the Transplant Group of the Spanish Association of Urology, held in Albacete. During the event, the importance of training and education in kidney transplantation was discussed, including practical courses and the use of advanced technology such as 3D printing. The program for normothermic abdominal preservation for controlled asystole donation (mobile ECMO) was mentioned as a key factor in the increase in donations. Castilla-La Mancha has performed more than 1,300 kidney transplants since the beginning of its program in 2003, with a focus on professional training and living donor kidney transplantation.

title: La patología que sufre el rey Carlos III, explicada por un urólogo
summary: King Charles III is scheduled for surgery next week to treat a benign condition known as benign prostatic obstruction, which is a non-cancerous cellular growth common in men over 50. Buckingham Palace announced that the condition causes prostate enlargement but is not cancerous. The surgery aims to remove the obstruction blocking urine flow. José Luis Álvarez-Ossorio, president of the Spanish Urology Association, explained that this pathology is prevalent, especially in older men, and can significantly affect quality of life. It's generally caused by hormonal changes due to aging, with other factors like diabetes, obesity, and hypertension also playing a role. Symptoms include urinary issues, frequent urgency, weak urine flow, or incontinence. Various surgical procedures are available, with the transurethral resection of the prostate being common. The use of Holmium laser is increasingly popular for its minimally invasive nature. Early consultation with a specialist is crucial for early detection and treatment. The Royal Household's announcement also aims to encourage men experiencing symptoms to seek medical advice.

title: 'José Manuel Cózar, un urólogo que puso España mirando a Granada en su 86º congreso de la Asociación Española ...
summary: José Manuel Cózar, a renowned urologist, played a significant role in the 86th congress of the Spanish Urology Association held in Granada, drawing attention to the city. The event, discussed in an edition of 'Habladurías' by Joan Carles March, focused on prostate cancer, the most common cancer among men, which lacks visibility compared to other cancers with lower incidence rates. The congress saw the participation of over 1,000 urologists from across Spain. It highlighted the importance of oncology in urology, with discussions on prostate, bladder, and kidney cancers, emphasizing the need for prevention, screening, and treatment. The article also touches on the broader issue of the lack of visibility and awareness of prostate cancer, despite its prevalence, and the efforts to address the needs of the thousands of men diagnosed each year.

title: Urólogos de toda España asisten en Jaén a la XIII Reunión Nacional del Grupo Español de Cáncer Renal y Tumor ...
summary: Urologists from across Spain are attending the XIII National Meeting of the Spanish Group for Kidney Cancer and Bladder Tumor in Jaén, organized by specialists from the University Hospital of Jaén, led by the head of the Urology Service, Juan Moreno. The meeting focuses on updates in the treatment of advanced and metastatic prostate cancer, highlighting significant improvements in patient survival due to new drugs introduced in the last decade. Around a hundred urologists are participating, facilitating the dissemination of studies, including the initial results of a clinical trial on bladder cancer promoted by the Spanish Association of Urology. This year's sessions also cover advancements in the treatment of urothelial and prostate cancer, with notable progress in hormonal drugs, PARP enzyme inhibitors, and immunotherapy, significantly impacting survival rates. The Spanish Group for Kidney Cancer, established 14 years ago, aims to share experiences and research on new treatments that have markedly increased survival and disease-free periods for patients with advanced and metastatic kidney cancer.

title: Aprobados los nuevos estatutos de las fundaciones gallegas de investigación sanitaria
hco: FUNDACION INSTITUTO DEINVESTIGACION SANITARIA DE SANTIAGO
summary: The Galician regional government has approved new statutes for three Galician health research foundations, integrating them into the autonomous public sector. This move, highlighted in the 2024 budget, allocates €22.7 million to the Santiago de Compostela Health Research Institute Foundation, €10.5 million to the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation, and €10 million to the Biomedical Foundation Galicia Sur. Following the approval of these new statutes and pending further approval by the Consello de la Xunta, the foundations will complete their incorporation process. They will be renamed as Public Galician Foundations with specific areas of operation across different health regions in Galicia. This initiative marks the first time these foundations have been included in the Galician budget, signifying a significant step towards their integration into the regional public sector and enhancing their operational capabilities in health research.

title: Roberto Verino dona 3.080 € para la lucha contra el Dent
hco: FUNDACION INSTITUTO DEINVESTIGACION SANITARIA DE SANTIAGO
summary: Roberto Verino has donated 3,080 euros to support research on Dent disease at the NefroChus laboratory, part of the Santiago Health Research Institute. This contribution was made during a visit by Dora Casal, CEO of Roberto Verino, to the facility. The donation will aid in investigating this renal disease, with the reception attended by notable figures such as Miguel Ángel García, director of NefroChus; Adela Urisarri, a pediatric nephrologist at CHUS; Isabel Lista García, director of the Santiago Health Research Institute Foundation; and María Castelao, president of the Galician association for Dent disease and mother of an affected child, Hugo from Brión.

title: GLADIATOR RACE SOLIDARIA EN BENEFICIO DE LA INVESTIGACIÓN DE LA ENFERMEDAD DE DENT. INICIATIVA ...
hco: FUNDACION INSTITUTO DEINVESTIGACION SANITARIA DE SANTIAGO
summary: The Gladiator Race Solidaria in Santiago, held on September 2, 2023, aimed to support research on Dent's disease through the Mediolanum Aproxima initiative. Organized by Javier Pena and backed by Banco Mediolanum, the event surpassed its €5,000 goal, raising €5,540 with 62 donations. The funds will aid the Health Research Institute of Santiago de Compostela (IDIS) and ART FOR DENT, a nonprofit association advocating for this rare kidney disease. Rewards for donors included invitations to a Michelin-starred restaurant, art pieces, and iconic t-shirts. The event, part of Mediolanum Aproxima's efforts to foster social commitment, saw over 250 participants joining team "Un Raio de Luz" to enhance disease visibility and research funding.

title: Ramiro Carregal entrega el premio de investigación en cardiología a la doctora Amparo Martínez Monzonís
hco: FUNDACION INSTITUTO DEINVESTIGACION SANITARIA DE SANTIAGO
summary: Ramiro Carregal awarded the International Research Prize in Cardiology on Valvular Heart Diseases to Dr. Amparo Martínez Monzonís for her work on tricuspid insufficiency, a condition historically overlooked in cardiology. The ceremony, held at the Hostal de los Reyes Católicos, recognized the team's research, which focuses on improving patient outcomes through advanced cardiac imaging techniques and percutaneous valve repair and replacement methods. The prize, amounting to thirty thousand euros, supports the study of pathological alterations affecting heart valves, which are a major cause of heart disease in Spain. The research aims to better predict patient evolution and identify optimal timing for surgical intervention, potentially reducing hospital admissions, stay durations, and associated mortality. This work will be conducted at the Complexo Hospitalario Universitario de Santiago with two hundred cardiology patients over the next two years.

title: Investigadoras del IDIS identifican un nuevo gen relacionado con las poliposis y el cáncer colorrectal
hco: FUNDACION INSTITUTO DEINVESTIGACION SANITARIA DE SANTIAGO
summary: Researchers from the Santiago Health Research Institute (IDIS) have identified a new gene, BMPR2, related to polyposis and colorectal cancer. This finding, published in the Gastroenterology journal, highlights the role of BMPR2 in the hereditary predisposition to develop colon polyps and colorectal cancer, a disease that represents one of the main causes of cancer mortality in Spain, with more than 28,000 new diagnoses and approximately 18,000 deaths annually. The research, led by Dr. Clara Ruiz Ponte and Ceres Fernández Rozadilla, in collaboration with Dr. Sergi Castellví-Bel and other specialists, has shown that up to 2% of the analyzed patients present hereditary genetic variants in the BMPR2 gene that can nullify the normal function of the BMPR2 protein, leading to an uncontrolled proliferation of colon epithelial cells, and therefore, to the formation of polyps and subsequent development of colorectal cancer. This discovery opens new avenues for early diagnosis and prevention of this disease.

title: El Colegio de Médicos de A Coruña acoge el viernes un encuentro sobre asistencia compartida
summary: The Official College of Physicians of A Coruña will host on April 19 the II Meeting of the shared assistance and interconsultation group of the Galician Society of Internal Medicine, focused on collaboration between surgeons and internists for the process of major abdominal surgeries. Organized by Dr. Héctor Meijide, head of the Internal Medicine Service at the Quirónsalud A Coruña Hospital, the meeting promotes multidisciplinary work to improve the recovery of patients, especially those of older age and complexity. Preoperative strategies, such as improving nutrition and exercise, will be discussed, with the participation of specialists from various fields to optimize patient health outcomes. This approach emphasizes the importance of preparing the patient for surgery to facilitate better postoperative rehabilitation.

title: Hector Meijide, internista: «Nuestra máxima es que es mejor prehabilitar que rehabilitar al paciente»
summary: Hector Meijide, an internist, emphasizes the importance of prehabilitation over rehabilitation for patients undergoing surgery, especially in the context of an aging population with increasing chronic diseases. Prehabilitation ensures patients are in the best possible condition before surgery, leading to quicker recoveries. The concept of shared care between surgeons and internists facilitates rapid patient recovery post-operation. This collaborative approach is becoming increasingly vital as the population ages and chronic pathologies rise. The II Meeting of the shared care and interconsultation group of the Galician Society of Internal Medicine, organized by Meijide, focused on abdominal, colon cancer, and hepatobiliary-pancreatic surgeries, highlighting the need for patients to be well-prepared beforehand. Shared care not only reduces hospital stays but also improves surgical outcomes by addressing pre-existing medical issues and potential post-operative complications. It is suggested that nearly all surgical patients could benefit from shared care, which takes into account various factors including mental health, frailty, and polypharmacy, before and after surgery.

title: Juan G. Soler, experto en obesidad: «Los médicos nos equivocábamos al recomendar caminar una hora al día»
summary: Juan G. Soler, an obesity expert and internist at CHUO, argues against the traditional advice of walking an hour a day for obesity treatment, highlighting the complexity and chronic nature of obesity. He emphasizes that obesity cannot be solely attributed to poor eating habits and inactivity, pointing out its multifactorial causes and the stigma associated with it. Soler advocates for a balanced Mediterranean diet, regular mixed exercise (combining cardio and strength training), and addressing obesity from a preventive standpoint rather than relying solely on medications or bariatric surgery. He criticizes the prevalence of unhealthy food in society, including in health centers, and stresses the importance of educating children on healthy lifestyle choices to combat the rising rates of childhood obesity. Soler's approach focuses on sensible, sustainable lifestyle changes rather than strict diets or intensive exercise regimes.

title: Cómo nadar en agua fría puede ayudarte a combatir la obesidad y el estrés
summary: Swimming in cold water can help fight obesity and stress by promoting the growth of brown body fat, which helps protect against obesity and diabetes by producing heat, unlike the harmful, energy-storing white fat. It increases the calories burned to maintain body temperature and helps prevent insulin resistance. Cold water swimming boosts circulation, which is good for people with varicose veins, and promotes blood and lymph flow, aiding in venous insufficiency. It also benefits heart and lung health. Mental health advantages include lowered stress levels through the release of endorphins, dopamine, and serotonin, improving happiness. A 2020 study found that regular ice swimming in individuals aged 65 to 85 led to fewer respiratory infections and slower aging, attributed to less free radical production. However, for temperatures below 15 degrees Celsius, proper training and equipment are necessary. Swimming in water temperatures between 15 and 21 degrees Celsius is generally healthier than in warmer waters. Slowly getting used to the water temperature is advised to prevent thermal shock, particularly for those with heart or lung issues. Extreme caution is recommended for young children and the elderly because they have more difficulty regulating their body temperature.

title: El coordinador de la Unidad de Sobrepeso de Vithas Vigo propone un enfoque integral para tratar la obesidad
summary: Juan José González Soler, coordinator of the Overweight and Obesity Unit at Vithas Vigo Hospital, has proposed a comprehensive approach to obesity treatment, highlighting the importance of interdisciplinary work. This approach includes collaboration from specialists in nutrition, physical exercise, psychology, and doctors and surgeons specialized in obesity and metabolism. During his participation in the fourth edition of the Annual Obesity Meeting in Madrid, González Soler emphasized the cardiovascular risk associated with obesity and the difficulty of separating it from other metabolic diseases and comorbidities. He underlined the need for personalized treatments that promote a change in habits and a healthy lifestyle, combining nutritional reeducation, physical exercise, and new drugs to effectively control the disease.

title: Vigo investiga la relación de la microbiota en cáncer de próstata
summary: A multidisciplinary team from Cunqueiro, led by the urologist Elena López Diez and with the urologist Adrián Freire as the principal investigator, has received a grant from the Galician Society of Urology and the “Julián Gutiérrez de Toledo” award for the best oral communication at the National Congress of Urology for their research on the risk factors of prostate cancer. The study, titled "Active surveillance in prostate cancer: immunohistochemical profile and microbiota," aims to identify risk factors that allow predicting which patients with prostate cancer will progress early. Including 40 patients with an average age of 67.1 years, the study evaluated the behavior of various genes and the intestinal microbiota, finding that the loss of the PTEN gene is a common alteration in prostate cancer, related to a faster progression of the disease. This field of research on the relationship between the gastrointestinal microbiota and prostate cancer is gaining interest.

title: Daniel López García: «24 horas al día, 365 días al año en sanidad privada es un logro»
summary: Daniel López García, the head of Urology at HM Modelo, received the best surgical video award at the XXXII Congress of the Galician Society of Urology held in Lugo. This accolade recognizes not just a specific case but the comprehensive, high-quality care model his team offers, operating 24/7, 365 days a year in private healthcare. This model, unique in Galicia's private healthcare, prioritizes minimal interference in patients' lives, adapting to their needs with personalized care and virtually no waiting times. López, who transitioned from public to private healthcare after his residency, has implemented a patient-centered approach, utilizing cutting-edge technology to enhance service quality. His work, including a stint in robotic surgery and training programs, has earned him visibility and recognition in his field.

title: «Sin miedo a vivir» campaña social sobre pacientes de cáncer de La Fundación MD Anderson Cancer Center España ...
summary: "Without fear of living" is a social campaign launched by the MD Anderson Cancer Center Spain Foundation and Havas, focused on cancer patients. The non-profit campaign aims to inspire and motivate society, especially those directly or indirectly affected by cancer, to enjoy life without fear. It is presented through a 3-minute audiovisual piece that shows the daily life and challenges of six cancer patients, highlighting a message of hope and the importance of living fully. The campaign is supported by large corporations and media outlets, and is broadcast through various channels including television, radio, outdoor advertising, and social networks. In addition, the initiative is complemented by a website that offers informational resources, testimonials, and content on the emotional management of cancer, seeking to generate an open dialogue about the fear of living in the face of the disease.

title: Dipcan, un estudio español para desafiar al cáncer
summary: Dipcan is a Spanish study initiated in 2022, focusing on personalized medicine for metastatic non-hematological tumor patients by integrating clinical, genomic, anatomopathological, and radiomic data from 2000 participants. Led by Enrique Grande of MD Anderson Cancer Center Spain, the project aims to create a comprehensive cancer database, potentially the largest in Europe, to facilitate precise diagnoses with a simple test in the future. Although observational and not providing treatment, Dipcan employs diagnostics and AI to develop an algorithm for better cancer management. It involves patient consultations and collaborates with several organizations, funded by the EU through the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Digital Transformation. The study highlights the importance of precision oncology, data measurement, and the need for collaborative networks among hospitals to ensure equal treatment access.

title: 'Sin Miedo a Vivir', movimiento que sitúa a los pacientes de cáncer como ejemplo de inspiración para la sociedad
summary: The "Sin Miedo a Vivir" movement, initiated by the MD Anderson Cancer Center Spain in collaboration with Havas, aims to position cancer patients as sources of inspiration and resilience for society. It highlights the importance of appreciating life and living without fear, even in the face of illness. An audiovisual piece accompanying the launch showcases the daily lives of six diverse patients, emphasizing that a cancer diagnosis should not stop one from living fully. Additionally, the foundation released a study on the emotional experiences of patients and their social circles, revealing that patients generally manage their emotions better than their relatives. The study, which surveyed 1,000 people across Spain, found that over 70% of patients can recognize and express their emotions during diagnosis, compared to only 25% of family members. The movement, which includes the participation of singer Rosana with her song "Sin miedo," seeks to motivate and encourage everyone to embrace life eagerly. It also introduces the "Sin Miedo a Vivir" community, a digital platform offering resources, patient testimonials, and support for those dealing with cancer.
