This agreement comes after the previous contract, which had been extended annually since 2019, was not renewed, leaving over 1,200 Canary Islanders without health coverage as of January 1st this year. The new six-month agreement reinstates all medical assistance and access to medicines previously provided. This initiative is part of the Autonomous Community's efforts since 2009 to support its vulnerable citizens in Venezuela, with a budget of 1.1 million euros allocated for this purpose in 2023, maintained for 2024. The vice-counselor of External Action highlighted the agreement's importance for updating services and costs, ensuring quality control, and continuing to provide essential health services to those in need.

title: Miranda y el director de la Fundación España Salud planifican la colaboración a desarrollar durante el nuevo año ...
summary: Antonio Rodríguez Miranda, the Secretary of Emigration, met with Álvaro Gómez, director of the Fundación España Salud, to outline their collaboration for the new year in Venezuela. They aim to continue supporting the socio-health needs of Galicians living in Venezuela, building on a €100,000 agreement with the foundation. This partnership focuses on providing medical and pharmaceutical care to Galicians with limited financial resources, often of advanced age, benefiting over 1,300 individuals.

title: Torres conoce la Fundación España Salud en Caracas que asiste a 3.400 canarios y dice que su servicio es ...
summary: The President of the Canary Islands, Ángel Víctor Torres, visited the Spain Health Foundation (FES) in Caracas, which assists 6,500 Spaniards, of whom 3,400 are Canarians. He highlighted the FES's service as "fundamental" and emphasized the work of its staff and inter-administrative collaboration. The FES provides primary care, hospitalization, surgery, home emergency care, and medication for chronic patients. The contribution of the Canary Islands Government to the FES has increased to 1.1 million euros in 2023. Torres stressed the importance of the healthcare provided by the FES given the difficulties in accessing medications in Venezuela and mentioned efforts to extend health coverage to other groups of the emigrant population.

title: Jornada 'El papel de la autorregulación en la promoción de medicamentos'
summary: The Real Academia de Medicina de Cataluña and Farmaindustria are organizing an event titled 'The Role of Self-Regulation in the Promotion of Medications' on November 16, 2023, in Barcelona. The session, taking place from 16:30 to 19:00 at the Academy's headquarters, aims to examine the self-regulation system within the pharmaceutical industry. This system, a pioneering model in Spain initiated over 20 years ago, was developed as a voluntary response by pharmaceutical companies to meet the expectations of their stakeholders and society at large. It sets forth criteria and standards of conduct to ensure trust and credibility in the promotion of medications and the interactions of the pharmaceutical industry. Attendance requires prior registration due to limited capacity.

title: Médicos aconsejan el cribado universal de embarazadas para evitar transmisión VIH a hijos
summary: Doctors and the Ministry of Health in Spain recommend universal HIV screening for all pregnant women in the first and third trimesters, regardless of risk, to eliminate transmission of the virus from mothers to children. Despite a low vertical transmission rate of 0.72%, the goal is its total eradication, emphasizing the importance of women with HIV reaching childbirth with an undetectable viral load. This approach is reflected in an updated consensus document, which also suggests screening for the partners of pregnant women. Early detection and access to antiretroviral treatment are crucial to prevent transmission. Natural conception and childbirth are prioritized in women with an undetectable viral load, and the possibility of natural breastfeeding is opened in special cases. Additionally, information on safe and effective antiretroviral treatments during pregnancy is updated.

title: Consenso español para optimizar el abordaje de la gripe
summary: In Spain, during the 2019/2020 flu season, there were 3,900 deaths directly attributed to influenza, over 600,000 primary care cases, and 27,000 hospitalizations. These alarming figures prompted five leading Spanish scientific societies to present a consensus document aimed at optimizing flu management. The document addresses clinical, microbiological, therapeutic, and preventive aspects of influenza for both pediatric and adult populations. It highlights the underuse of flu vaccines, with only 43% of pregnant women and 53% of those over 65 vaccinated. The consensus also discusses the importance of early antiviral treatment, specifically oseltamivir, to reduce hospitalization time, severe complications, and mortality. It calls for improved access to approved but not nationally funded antiviral drugs and emphasizes the need for vaccination, especially among vulnerable populations, to mitigate the flu's impact on morbidity and mortality.

title: Elaboran un documento de consenso sobre diagnóstico, tratamiento y profilaxis del virus de la gripe
summary: The Spanish Society of Infectious Diseases, in collaboration with other health organizations, has developed a consensus document on the diagnosis, treatment, and prophylaxis of the influenza virus. This document addresses clinical, microbiological, therapeutic, and preventive aspects for both pediatric and adult populations. The aim is to improve the management of the infection and reduce its impact on public health and the healthcare system. The influenza virus, known for causing annual epidemics and occasional pandemics, presents significant challenges to society and healthcare systems due to its respiratory infections and associated complications.

title: La "pesadilla" de los pediatras por la falta de antibióticos para niños
summary: Pediatricians in Spain are facing a "nightmare" due to a shortage of antibiotics for children, leading to the need to prescribe multiple medications to avoid parents' pharmacy pilgrimages for unavailable drugs. This situation, exacerbated by a streptococcus A outbreak, has forced healthcare professionals to resort to less-than-ideal alternatives. Scientific pediatric societies have highlighted this as a serious health issue for children and are calling for immediate action to address the shortage, which is partly attributed to Spain's medication price caps making certain drugs scarce as they fetch higher prices elsewhere. The shortage, affecting basic pediatric antibiotics like Amoxicillin and Augmentine, complicates medical consultations and treatment processes, with professionals urging for solutions beyond substituting drugs.

title: Jesús Porta-Etessam, nuevo presidente de la Sociedad Española de Neurología
summary: Jesús Porta-Etessam has been appointed as the new president of the Spanish Society of Neurology (SEN), taking over from his previous role as the head of the Neurology Section at the Hospital Clínico San Carlos in Madrid, where he leads the Headache and Neuro-ophthalmology Units. The SEN, with over 4,500 members, has also appointed new vice-presidents and board members. Porta-Etessam, who is a licensed physician and surgeon with a doctorate from the Complutense University of Madrid and also teaches there, has previously held the position of vice-president and director of Institutional Relations at SEN, as well as heading its Culture Area and Brain Foundation. His election and the introduction of the new board took place during the SEN's General Assembly, after a voting period and an extraordinary meeting at the society's Annual Meeting. Their term is expected to last for at least two years, with the next elections planned for November 2025.

title: IncubaSEN, la primera incubadora de startups del mundo, es lanzada hoy por la Sociedad Española de Neurología
summary: IncubaSEN, launched today by the Spanish Society of Neurology (SEN), is the world's first startup incubator created within a clinical neurology scientific society and the first from a Spanish scientific society. Its purpose is to foster the development of technological solutions in the clinical field, emerging from specific and relevant needs identified in Neurology. The program aims to create technology solutions for real clinical needs, moving beyond adapting existing technologies for neurological patients. IncubaSEN emphasizes the development of specific technological solutions for neurological clinical challenges and supports these initiatives from the start with technological engineers and business mentors. The project begins with a selection phase to define innovative and feasible clinical challenges in neurology, followed by a Hackathon to develop conceptual prototypes, and concludes with an incubation phase leading to a final presentation in Madrid. The winning team will have the opportunity to further develop their technological solution in a professional accelerator. IncubaSEN is coordinated by Dr. David Ezpeleta, Dr. Iñigo Gabilondo Cuéllar, and Dr. Álvaro Sánchez-Ferro, with collaboration from companies like AbbVie, Esteve, Novartis, and Organon.

title: Las diez claves para mantener un cerebro saludable, según la Sociedad Española de Neurología
summary: The Spanish Society of Neurology has developed a ten-point list of advice for the general public to keep their brain healthy. These tips emphasize the importance of sleep and a balanced diet, among other things. Around 1.5 million people in Spain suffer from a severe neurological condition, and another five to six million have a less severe illness that affects their quality of life. Neurological diseases are a major cause of death and disability. The aim of the ten-point list, as neurologist Cristina Íñiguez explains, is to promote healthy brain aging, especially considering the increase in life expectancy and the subsequent rise in neurodegenerative diseases. The advice includes common-sense suggestions such as avoiding being overweight, staying away from toxins like alcohol and tobacco, managing vascular risk factors, nurturing social connections, adhering to a Mediterranean diet, ensuring quality sleep, limiting screen and social media time, wearing protective equipment like helmets, and keeping a positive outlook.

title: La Unidad de Trastornos del Movimiento del Hospital Puerta de Hierro recibe la acreditación de calidad de la ...
summary: The Movement Disorders Unit of the Puerta de Hierro University Hospital in Majadahonda, Madrid, has received a quality accreditation from the Spanish Society of Neurology (SEN), being the first non-surgical medical unit in the region to obtain such recognition. This achievement highlights the unit's excellence in the treatment of movement disorders, such as Parkinson's, and reinforces its position as a reference center. Since its creation in 1988, it has served more than 10,000 patients, with a comprehensive and multidisciplinary approach. The accreditation evaluates aspects such as patient safety, the humanization of care, and technology management. The accreditation process is demanding, including an external audit to identify and correct deficiencies, thus ensuring high-quality health service.

title: Jesús Porta-Etessam, nuevo Presidente de la Sociedad Española de Neurología
summary: Jesús Porta-Etessam has been appointed as the new President of the Spanish Society of Neurology (SEN) during the Extraordinary General Assembly at the Annual Meeting of the SEN.

title: La Unidad Trastornos del Movimiento del Hospital Universitario de Toledo, acreditada a nivel nacional por la Sociedad ...
summary: The Movement Disorders Unit at the University Hospital of Toledo, part of the Health Service of Castilla-La Mancha (SESCAM), has been nationally accredited by the Spanish Society of Neurology (SEN) for its comprehensive approach to Parkinson's disease and other movement disorders. This recognition was highlighted during a ceremony presided over by SESCAM's General Director of Healthcare, Ibrahim Hernández, who emphasized the dedication of healthcare professionals to improving patient quality of life. The unit, coordinated by Dr. Nuria López Ariztegui since 2010, has expanded its service offerings since its monographic Parkinson's consultation began in 1997. Over the past year, the unit has managed over 3,300 consultations, including treatments like deep brain stimulation and drug infusion pumps for conditions not manageable with conventional medication. The accreditation process involved a thorough external audit by SEN auditors, focusing on patient safety, care humanization, and management improvements, reflecting a commitment to high-quality, effective healthcare services.

title: La Sociedad Española de Neurología elabora el libro 'Neurología y Mujer' para mejorar el manejo de las ...
summary: The Spanish Society of Neurology has published the book "Neurology and Women" to address the management of specific neurological diseases in women, highlighting that more than half of them will develop a neurological disease in their lifetime. The book points out that women have a higher prevalence of stroke, migraine, Alzheimer's disease, insomnia, and multiple sclerosis compared to men. These conditions not only differ in frequency but also in severity and impact on quality of life. In addition, factors such as pregnancy, menopause, and hormonal treatments significantly influence the management of these diseases. The book, written entirely by female neurologists, seeks to provide a clinical tool that considers the particularities of neurological diseases in women, including aspects related to female leadership in neurology.

title: El Dr. Jesús Porta-Etessam, nuevo Presidente de la Sociedad Española de Neurología
summary: Dr. Jesús Porta-Etessam has been elected as the new President of the Spanish Society of Neurology (SEN), a scientific entity that brings together more than 4,500 members, including most neurologists in Spain. Porta-Etessam, currently Head of the Neurology Section at the San Carlos Clinical Hospital in Madrid and Professor at the Complutense University of Madrid, has extensive training and experience in the field of neurology. He has significantly contributed to the scientific community through his participation in various educational and cultural initiatives related to neurology. In addition, he has been recognized for his leadership and his contribution to the research and treatment of headaches, among other achievements. Along with him, a new Board of Directors for the SEN has been elected, which will assume responsibilities in different areas, from institutional relations to neurotechnology and artificial intelligence. These appointments have been made effective after the corresponding electoral process, and the positions will be held for a period of two years, with the next elections scheduled for November 2025.

title: Dos neurólogas aragonesas, reelegidas para la Junta Directiva de la Sociedad Española de Neurología
summary: Two Aragonese neurologists, Dr. Cristina Íñiguez Martínez and Dr. Silvia Gil Navarro, have been re-elected to the Board of Directors of the Spanish Society of Neurology (SEN). Dr. Íñiguez will continue as vice president and will be responsible for the Institutional Relations Area, while Dr. Gil Navarro has been reappointed as a member of the Social Relations Area and will be responsible for the Member Services Area. The SEN is a scientific society with more than 4,500 members, including most Spanish neurologists. The appointments were made effective after the electoral process. Dr. Íñiguez is the Head of the Neurology Service at the Lozano Blesa University Clinical Hospital in Zaragoza and has a distinguished academic and professional record. Dr. Gil Navarro, a specialist in Cognition and Behavior Disorders, works at the Emili Mira Center of the Parc de Salut Mar in Barcelona and has extensive experience in research and teaching.

title: La SEN confía en que la actualización de la Estrategia del Ictus contribuirá a disminuir
summary: The Spanish Society of Neurology (SEN) is confident that the recent update of the Stroke Strategy of the National Health System (SNS) will significantly contribute to reducing both the incidence and the impact of stroke in Spain. Stroke remains the leading cause of disability and the second cause of mortality in the country, being the first in women. The update of the strategy, initially presented in 2009 and revised in 2013 and 2021, seeks to improve healthcare at all levels for this cerebrovascular disease. The revision incorporates scientific advances and changes in diagnostics and treatments, emphasizing the importance of prevention and rapid and effective care. The SEN highlights that up to 90% of cases could be avoided by controlling modifiable risk factors such as hypertension and smoking. This update also seeks to reduce variability in care and resources available among the different autonomous communities.

title: El Congreso de la Sociedad Andaluza de Farmacia Hospitalaria reúne a más de 300 expertos en Sevilla
summary: The 19th Congress of the Andalusian Society of Hospital Pharmacy, held in Seville, brought together over 300 experts from Andalusia, Extremadura, and the Canary Islands. Themed "Analyze to Advance," the event focused on the challenges facing the specialized pharmaceutical profession and how demographic and social changes impact it. The congress aimed to address these challenges through analysis and discussion among professionals.

title: Ministerio, CCAA y farmacéuticos coinciden en las líneas estratégicas de la evaluación | @diariofarma
summary: At the 19th Congress of the Andalusian Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SAFH) held in Seville, a roundtable discussion took place on the current changes in the evaluation and financing model for medications in Spain. This comes in light of the upcoming new Royal Decree on Health Technology Assessment, aimed to replace the previous model nullified by the courts, known as Revalmed. Participants, including César Hernández from the SNS and Pharmacy, and representatives from various health sectors, debated the future direction of medication evaluation and financing. They highlighted the current system's imbalance, with a lack of evidence generation at the approval or financing decisions, issues with medication depreciation affecting supply, and obstacles in accessing medications or promoting competition with generics or biosimilars. The discussion also touched on the need for a clear, standard, and transparent alternative to complete the therapeutic positioning reports (IPT) by the Spanish Agency for Medicines (Aemps), which are not as comprehensive as those by Revalmed. Additionally, the new European HTA regulation, effective in 2025, was seen as an opportunity to develop a robust evaluation and financing model for medications.

title: La Fundación Andaluza de Farmacia Hospitalaria convoca sus becas de investigación y formación | @diariofarma
summary: The Andalusian Foundation for Hospital Pharmacy (FAFH) has launched its 2023 scholarship and grant program, aimed at fostering research and enhancing the education of hospital pharmacists in Andalusia. A total of 19 grants amounting to €43,500 are available for projects related to hospital pharmacy. These include five €1,200 scholarships for training rotations in Andalusia, five €1,500 scholarships for national rotations, three grants of up to €3,000 for postgraduate academic training (Doctoral Theses), and five grants of up to €3,000 for research projects. Additionally, there is a €6,000 grant for coordinating the maintenance group of the Reference Pharmacotherapeutic Guide of the Andalusian Public Health Service (SSPA). The scholarships and grants, which are not subject to tax withholding, are open to hospital pharmacy specialists and/or resident pharmacists from any public or private hospital in Andalusia who are members of the SAFH. Applications must be submitted by March 7, with a digital signature to the attention of FAFH President Juan Enrique Martínez de la Plata via email.

title: SAFH reúne a 200 especialistas en su 18º Congreso | @diariofarma
summary: The 18th Congress of the Andalusian Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SAFH) will gather around 200 pharmacists, researchers, and experts from Andalusia and the rest of Spain in Málaga from April 19 to 21. The congress aims to share experiences, projects, and work models among healthcare professionals, focusing on patient care and optimizing access and use of medications. Key topics include patient safety evaluation, hospital practices for safe medication use, quality care innovation, and humanization perspectives in Hospital Pharmacy. It will also highlight successful experiences from Andalusian hospital pharmacy services. The theme "More visible, more secure. Adding in quality care" reflects the congress's goal to emphasize the hospital pharmacist's role in improving patient health and care quality through safe practices and professional excellence. The event is organized by Begoña Tortajada and Marga Garrido Siles, leading figures in the field from the Hospital Costa del Sol and the Hospital Virgen de la Victoria, respectively.

title: El Biobanco del Incliva conserva 400.000 muestras biológicas humanas de más de 20.000 donantes
summary: Since its foundation in 2013, the Incliva Biobank has collected 400,000 human biological samples from more than 20,000 donors, coming from patients with various pathologies. These samples are available to the research community, having handled more than 150 requests and participated in the management of samples for about thirty clinical trials in areas such as oncology, cardiovascular diseases, among others. Notably, it has contributed to the development of the Spanish vaccine against COVID-19 (Bimervax). In 2022, the Biobank received samples from 1,500 new donors, generated almost 60,000 new aliquots, and delivered 9,500 samples to research. This year it has incorporated samples from approximately 1,000 new donors. The donation of organs and tissues, as well as biological samples, is governed by legislation that ensures altruism, respect for the will of the donors, and anonymity. Incliva is a key platform for biomedical research, storing and distributing samples for studies of various pathologies.

title: Sagunto presenta la VII Carrera Solidaria Amuhcanma de este domingo
summary: Sagunto is hosting the seventh edition of the Amuhcanma Charity Race this Sunday, May 7th, to support breast cancer research. Organized by the Association of Women and Men Affected by Breast Cancer (Amuhcanma), the event features non-competitive 5 and 10-kilometer races, with registration closing today. The children's race starts at 10 a.m., followed by the adult race at 10:30 a.m. in Puerto de Sagunto. The event, which already has over 1400 participants, aims to raise awareness and funds for breast cancer research, with proceeds going to the INCLIVA Foundation and FISABIO. Local authorities and athletes, including Olympic athlete Laura Méndez, support the race, highlighting its inclusive and celebratory nature. This year marks the association's tenth anniversary, and they hope to surpass last year's fundraising record. Participation is also possible through Fila 0 for those unable to attend in person.

title: Fallece a los 84 años Rafael Carmena, catedrático de Medicina y Endocrinología y Premi Rei Jaume I en 2002
summary: Rafael Carmena, a distinguished professor of Medicine and Endocrinology and the winner of the Premi Rei Jaume I in 2002, passed away at the age of 84. Carmena had a notable career at the universities of València and Murcia, where he made significant contributions to medical pathology and endocrinology. He served as the director general of the INCLIVA Research Institute from 2012 to 2017 and was a leading researcher in cardiometabolic risk and diabetes. His work focused on lipid metabolism, insulin resistance, and the treatment of metabolic syndrome and dyslipidemia in diabetes. Carmena was also an emeritus professor at the University of Valencia, where he had been teaching since 1982, and had held visiting professor positions in Minnesota, Montreal, and La Plata. He published over 200 research papers, directed more than thirty doctoral theses, and authored ten significant books. Carmena's death is mourned by the medical and scientific community, recognizing his contributions to health research and public health standards improvement.

title: Una investigación valenciana determina si los traumas en la infancia y adolescencia predisponen a la depresión en edad adulta
summary: A study in Valencia, led by the Health Research Institute (Incliva), analyzes how traumas during childhood and adolescence can predispose to depression in adulthood. The study, which has the collaboration of several hospitals and has been funded by the Alicia Koplowitz Foundation, focuses on the impact of these adverse experiences on the thalamus, a key brain region in the processing of sensory and motor information. Postmortem samples and techniques such as magnetic resonance imaging will be used to investigate changes in the structure and functioning of the thalamus. The project, which seeks to contribute to the development of more effective therapies against depression, will be carried out in both sexes, given the higher prevalence of this disease in women. Depression is a disorder with a high social and economic cost, affecting both individuals and their environment.

title: Investigadores decodifican mecanismos celulares y moleculares del síndrome de Asherman
summary: Spanish researchers have decoded the cellular and molecular mechanisms of Asherman's Syndrome at a single-cell level, a condition characterized by intrauterine scarring that can result in amenorrhea (absence of menstruation). The study, led by Dr. Carlos Simón and his team from the University of Valencia, Incliva Health Research Institute, and the Carlos Simón Foundation, and published in Nature Communications, marks the first time the cellular alterations responsible for Asherman's Syndrome have been described at this resolution. It identifies gene expression profiles that create a dysfunctional environment, leading to scar tissue formation, inflammation, and vascular changes. The research involved patients diagnosed with moderate to severe Asherman's Syndrome, fertile women, and healthy donors as control groups. Additionally, endometrial organoids derived from affected patients and healthy women were created, displaying similar characteristics to in vivo endometrial tissue, suggesting their efficacy as an in vitro model for studying the syndrome. The analysis of over 200,000 cells from the endometrium of patients and healthy controls, along with advanced machine learning models, helped uncover transcriptomic differences between in vivo and in vitro endometrial cells of patients and controls, providing deeper insights into the endometrial microenvironment's alterations in the disease. This study is part of an ongoing clinical trial aiming to validate the effects of stem cell therapy on reproductive clinical outcomes in affected patients.

title: El Incliva inicia un estudio en busca de biomarcadores genéticos en la osteoporosis postmenopáusica
summary: The INCLIVA Health Research Institute in Valencia has initiated a study to identify genetic and epigenetic biomarkers in postmenopausal osteoporosis, focusing on bone mineral density and the risk of fragility fractures. Funded with 115,000 euros from the Ministry of Science and Innovation, the project led by Dr. Miguel Ángel García Pérez aims to improve the diagnosis and prevention of this pathology, which mainly affects women and has significant socioeconomic and clinical relevance. The research focuses on identifying genetic variants associated with an increased risk of osteoporosis and fractures, as well as studying micro-RNAs as potential biomarkers. In addition, experts from various fields are collaborating, and samples from patients with bone fractures will be used, contributing to a better understanding and management of osteoporosis.

title: Investigadores sevillanos utilizan modelos de cultivo 3D para definir patrones de agresividad en el sarcoma de Ewing
summary: Sevillian researchers are using 3D culture models to identify patterns of aggression in Ewing's sarcoma. Scientists from IBiS and Virgen del Rocío Hospital in Sevilla, along with Incliva-UV from Valencia, will analyze tumor cell behavior using artificial matrices and depending on the presence of vitronectin. The research, co-led by doctors Enrique de Álava, Juan Díaz, Rosa Noguera, and Amparo López-Carrasco, is funded by the CRIS Cancer Foundation and will last three years. Ewing's sarcoma is a rare type of cancer, primarily affecting bones or soft tissue around bones, and is the second most common primary malignant bone tumor in children in Spain. Despite advancements in treatment, survival rates are below 20% for patients with primary disseminated disease or relapse. The project aims to use 3D culture models with or without added vitronectin to grow various malignant cell types derived from patient tumors and characterize their behavior. This could provide significant diagnostic and prognostic information and potentially lead to the development of new therapies targeting vitronectin's interaction with tumor cells.

title: ¿Un cambio de servicio clínico o centro genera estrés a las enfermeras? Arranca un estudio para medir la ansiedad de ...
summary: A study led by the University of Huelva and the Spanish Nursing Research Institute of the General Nursing Council (CGE) aims to analyze stress in nurses facing changes in clinical service or center, a situation that can generate anxiety due to the transition from a known environment to an unknown one. This research addresses the need to understand the impact of labor mobility on the mental health of nurses, especially in a context where Spain faces a chronic shortage of nursing professionals, which threatens the quality of the healthcare system and the well-being of an aging population with chronic diseases. The study also addresses the "environmental reality shock" that nurses experience when joining professional practice, characterized by stress and anxiety, and seeks to provide tools to manage these challenges, preserving their mental health to ensure the provision of quality care.

title: A study by UPF and BCNatal opens the door to designing therapies to improve lung development in growth-restricted ...
summary: A study by UPF and BCNatal has advanced in developing therapies to improve lung growth in fetuses with restricted growth. This research is crucial as it fills a gap in understanding how restricted fetal growth affects lung development, an area not as well-studied as its impact on brain and cardiovascular development. The study analyzed blood flow in 208 pregnant women's fetuses, using AI and computer models to examine changes in lung vascular resistance. It found that fetuses with restricted growth had different blood velocity and vascular resistance in the lungs compared to those with normal growth. Notably, giving extra oxygen to the mothers improved blood flow in the lungs of the restricted-growth fetuses, indicating a possible treatment to prevent respiratory issues in these newborns, with benefits extending into later life. This research paves the way for creating treatments to enhance lung function in fetuses with restricted growth, reducing the risk of post-birth respiratory diseases.

title: Conjoined twins separated at Barcelona hospital to grow up with 'perfect quality of life'
summary: Conjoined twins Khadija and Cherive, born on October 8 in Mauritania conjoined at the abdomen, were successfully separated at Barcelona's Sant Joan de Déu Hospital. This operation marks the hospital's first separation of Siamese twins, involving a complex procedure that required the collaboration of multiple medical teams. The twins were brought to Spain on October 25 through the hospital's solidarity program, after Mauritanian authorities sought assistance. The surgery's complexity was heightened by the twins being conjoined by their livers, though fortunately, both livers functioned normally and independently. A virtual and printed simulation of the conjoined organs was created to prepare for the operation, identifying 50 critical items for the medical team to consider. The successful separation promises the twins a chance to grow independently with a "perfect quality of life." They are expected to be discharged at the beginning of next week, healthy and ready to start their new lives.

title: Unicaja Banco y el Colegio de Médicos de Málaga refuerzan su relación
summary: Unicaja Banco and the Official College of Physicians of Málaga (Commálaga) have renewed their collaboration agreement, continuing the bank's support for the professional organization. This partnership provides over 10,100 medical professionals in the province with access to specialized products and services. The agreement, signed by Francisco José Reguera Nieto, Unicaja Banco's Commercial Banking Director in Málaga, and Pedro J. Navarro, President of the College of Physicians of Málaga, aims to strengthen the relationship between the two entities. It offers favorable conditions for medical professionals, including an exclusive loan for new licensees to cover registration fees and the first year of membership, comprehensive financial services, and financing for investments in starting or improving medical practices and purchasing equipment. This collaboration is part of Unicaja Banco's efforts to support employment and economic recovery in Málaga province by partnering with major professional and business associations.

title: La Dra. Emilia Villegas, de Vithas Málaga y Vithas Xanit, recibe el Premio 2023 del Colegio de Médicos de Málaga
summary: Dr. Emilia Villegas, a specialist in laparoscopic gynecological surgery and robotic surgery applied to gynecology, has been awarded the 2023 Prize by the Malaga College of Physicians. She works at Vithas Malaga and Vithas Xanit Internacional, and is recognized for her contribution to endometriosis and other areas of gynecology and obstetrics. Her career includes outstanding clinical, academic, and research work, which earned her the Excellent Quality Accreditation by the Quality Agency of the Andalusian Regional Government in 2012. This award represents a special recognition from her colleagues and the Malaga College of Physicians, an institution she holds in high regard.

title: Emilia Villegas recibe el Premio 2023 del Colegio de Médicos de Málaga
summary: Emilia Villegas Muñoz, head of the Gynecology and Obstetrics Unit at Vithas Málaga and Vithas Xanit International hospitals, received the 2023 Award from the Málaga Medical Association. This accolade recognizes her more than 30-year career dedicated to medicine and patient care. A pioneer in laparoscopic gynecological surgery and a leading specialist in robotic surgery applied to gynecology, Villegas is also a reference in the field of endometriosis. Her clinical, academic, and research activities have been previously acknowledged in 2012 with the Excellence Quality Accreditation by the Andalusian Quality Agency. Villegas expressed gratitude for the award, highlighting its significance as a recognition from her professional peers and the esteemed institution of the Málaga Medical Association.

title: Expertos comparten su conocimiento en terapias genéticas en enfermedades raras en Málaga
summary: Experts shared their knowledge on gene therapy for rare diseases in Málaga during a course held on September 22-23 at the Official College of Physicians of Málaga (Commálaga). This event, organized by the Ibima rare area of the Biomedical Research Institute of Málaga and the Nanomedicine Platform (Ibima Plataforma Bionand), brought together national and international specialists. Gene therapy is a therapeutic technique that involves transferring a functional gene into a patient's cells to correct a genetic defect causing a pathology. This method is currently being applied in the treatment of various genetic diseases, especially useful for Rare Diseases. The opening event featured coordinators from Ibima Rare, Miguel Ángel Medina and Raquel Yahyaoui, and the president of the Official College of Physicians of Málaga, Pedro Navarro. The training activity is in the process of being accredited by the Andalusian Health Quality Agency (ACSA).

title: Málaga perdió 640 médicos que se fueron a otra provincia o emigraron desde 2018
summary: Málaga has lost 640 doctors since 2018, with the majority moving to other Spanish provinces and a smaller percentage emigrating abroad. The local medical association emphasizes the need for long-term contracts and better working conditions to retain medical residents. Despite being an attractive location, Málaga faces challenges in keeping medical professionals, mainly due to better opportunities and conditions elsewhere. The emigration trend has slightly decelerated, but the issue persists, impacting the local healthcare system and leading to a loss of public investment in medical training. The association calls for improved labor and economic conditions to not only keep doctors in Málaga but also attract professionals from other regions.

title: El Colegio de Médicos de Málaga homenajea a 15 profesionales de la Serranía
summary: The Malaga College of Physicians has paid tribute to 15 medical professionals from the Serranía de Ronda for their outstanding professional careers. This recognition highlights the importance of rural medicine and the human care quality these professionals contribute. The event, chaired by important figures from the College of Physicians and health authorities, took place on March 27, 2023. The honorees were Marta Amaya Guerrero, Victoriano Castellanos Guerrero, Andrés Avelino Écija Salto, Sergio Fons Cañizares, Vicente García Ramírez, Ana Martín Gil del Corral, María Luisa González Serrano, Román Manteca González, Joaquín Morales Jiménez, María de las Mercedes Orellana Moreno, María Dolores Rivera Fenoy, Andrés Ruz Montes, Francisco Sánchez Ramos, María Teresa Serrato Llamas, and Federico Serratosa Gutiérrez, thus recognizing their contribution to the community.

title: Médicos de Málaga exigen medidas ante la "alarmante tendencia al alza" de las agresiones
summary: Medical professionals in Málaga are calling for urgent action due to a worrying increase in assaults, with a notable rise in recent years. Most victims are young women in public health. Both the Medical Association and Medical Union in Málaga have labeled the Andalusian Health Service's (SAS) anti-assault plan as a failure. Assaults at healthcare centers in Málaga went up by 43% in 2022 compared to 2021, with early 2023 showing a further increase. They want better security, including alerts for known attackers, emergency security contracts, and increased surveillance at centers. They also seek legal reforms for better protection of healthcare workers, similar to that for judges and police. A campaign called "Don't assault me, it's a crime" has been started to raise awareness.

title: El Colegio de Médicos de Córdoba entrega sus terceros premios de investigación en atención primaria
summary: The Córdoba College of Physicians has awarded its third National Research Awards in Primary Care, highlighting areas such as rural care, emergencies, and other administrations. With the collaboration of AMA, Cajasur Foundation, and the Red Cross Hospital of Córdoba, 21 projects from various parts of Spain were received, carried out by more than 80 researchers. The awards recognized research on persistent COVID-19, prevention of diabetes in children through the Mediterranean diet, the impact of the pandemic on elderly care in emergencies, and compliance with the European directive on working hours for resident doctors. The president of the College of Physicians, Carmen Arias, highlighted the effort of medical professionals in research, especially in the current context. The event was attended by representatives of the Junta de Andalucía and other local authorities.

title: El Colegio Oficial de Médicos de Córdoba reconoce la labor del COE en su encuentro 'Salud para el Deporte'
summary: The Official College of Physicians of Córdoba celebrated the 'Health for Sport' event, highlighting the importance of promoting healthy habits such as physical activity and proper nutrition. The event was attended by important figures such as Jesús Aguirre Muñoz, president of the Andalusian Parliament, and Alejandro Blanco, president of the Spanish Olympic Committee, who received an acknowledgment for the COE's work in promoting a healthy life through sport. In addition, the collaboration of the College with various institutions to encourage these healthy habits among the population was highlighted. The keynote lecture was given by Dr. Antonio Escribano Zafra, a specialist in endocrinology and nutrition, who spoke about the importance of nutrition in health and sport.

title: Unas jornadas demuestran la utilidad de la IA y el Big Data para diagnósticos, tratamientos y pronósticos
summary: The first Innovation in Medicine Conference, held at Hospital Quirónsalud Córdoba and organized by the Official College of Physicians of Córdoba with AMA's collaboration, focused on the application of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Big Data, and Smart Data in medical diagnostics, treatments, and prognostics. The event gathered numerous medical and healthcare management professionals to discuss the integration of these technologies into medical practice. Despite the promising applications of AI and data analytics in improving patient care, such as early detection and treatment of chronic kidney disease and breast cancer screening, experts emphasized that these technologies are meant to assist but not replace medical professionals. The conference concluded with a commitment to continue exploring the potential of AI in medicine in future meetings, highlighting its role as an indispensable tool in decision-making and patient care.

title: El colegio de Médicos celebra su primera Jornada sobre Innovación Médica
summary: The Official College of Physicians of Córdoba celebrated its first Conference on Innovation in Medicine on April 3, 2024, at the Quirónsalud Córdoba Hospital, with the collaboration of AMA. The event focused on the application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in diagnosis, treatment, research, and health data management. It featured lectures and debates on the use of AI and Smart Data in medicine, highlighting their utility in the early detection and treatment of diseases such as chronic kidney failure and breast cancer. Participants concluded that these tools are essential allies for physicians in decision-making, although they cannot replace them. It was announced that there will be future conferences on the topic due to the interest generated.

title: El Colegio de Médicos de Córdoba y Caixabank convocan la 21 edición de sus Premios de Investigación
summary: The College of Physicians of Córdoba and Caixabank have announced the call for the 21st edition of their Research Awards, an initiative that seeks to support and recognize the work of researchers in the field of medicine. The collaboration between both institutions has been renewed to continue offering institutional and economic support to these established awards. In the previous edition, 46 works were presented by more than 500 researchers from 20 different countries, reflecting the diversity and global reach of the call. The organizers expect high participation for this new edition, highlighting the commitment and dedication of medical researchers, especially in the context of the current challenges facing medicine. This event underscores the importance of private patronage, such as that of CaixaBank, in promoting Spain's competitiveness in scientific research and in recognizing researchers.

title: Los médicos de Córdoba premian el estudio 'Cordioprev', sobre los beneficios de la dieta mediterránea
summary: Doctors in Córdoba awarded the 'Cordioprev' study, which highlights the benefits of the Mediterranean diet, at the 21st edition of their Research Awards. The study, a randomized clinical trial conducted at the Reina Sofía University Hospital in Córdoba, compares the Mediterranean diet with a low-fat diet in the secondary prevention of cardiovascular diseases. Results published in The Lancet indicate that the Mediterranean diet reduces the incidence of major cardiovascular events compared to the low-fat diet. The study has received global recognition, including multiple national awards and inclusion among the most influential articles by the European Society of Cardiology. The event was supported by CaixaBank and highlighted the participation of researchers of various nationalities, including a strong representation of doctors from Córdoba.

title: El Colegio de Médicos de Córdoba premia tres proyectos de investigación
summary: The Colegio de Médicos de Córdoba awarded its second National Research Prizes in Primary Care, recognizing three research projects from a pool of 22 submissions involving over 100 researchers, including about 30 from Córdoba. The awards ceremony, supported by AMA Entidad Aseguradora, Fundación Cajasur, and Hospital Cruz Roja de Córdoba, highlighted the institution's strong commitment to research despite challenging times. Two new categories were introduced this year to honor areas like emergency services and other administrations. The event featured notable attendees, including José Carlos Gómez Villamandos, María Jesús Botella, and Luis Luego, among others. The awards aim to encourage research by medical professionals across Spain, offering five modalities with prizes including cash and conference registrations for medical residents.

title: Organon y F. Gaspar Casal presentan el 'Mapa de salud con perspectiva' por la salud de la mujer
summary: Organon and the Gaspar Casal Foundation have introduced the 'Health Map with Perspective' as a pioneering online tool in Spain, designed to compare mortality and morbidity data of various diseases nationally and regionally, through different indicators. The tool aims to highlight female health by comparing data between men and women, addressing the under-researched area of women's health and its impact on understanding and responding to diseases. The platform, which gathers data from public sources like the National Institute of Statistics and the Ministry of Health, is seen as a step towards social justice and well-being for all Spaniards. It is expected to facilitate the identification of healthcare system deficiencies, enable more accurate decision-making, and potentially be adapted for use in other countries. The platform is unique for its interactive and public service nature, providing data in an accessible and interconnected manner, which is a novelty in Spain.

title: Novo Nordisk y Fundación Gaspar Casal analizan el estado de la situación de la obesidad adulta e infantil en Euskadi
summary: Novo Nordisk and the Gaspar Casal Foundation have analyzed obesity in adults and children in the Basque Country, identifying key action areas for its prevention and treatment. Obesity, an epidemic in Europe according to WHO, affects nearly 45% of Basque adults and over 25% of children. This complex issue stems from genetic, lifestyle, economic, and environmental factors, making it a challenging problem due to its multifaceted causes. However, tackling obesity is crucial because it's linked to a higher risk of chronic diseases and increased mortality, causing 8% of deaths in Spain. The report calls for a coordinated effort across health, social, education, and urban planning sectors, emphasizing primary care's role in combating obesity. It also highlights the need for community participation in creating new social initiatives and adopting a "health in all policies" approach to address obesity.

title: Mapa de la Salud con Perspectiva
summary: The Gaspar Casal Foundation and the Global Health company Organon have launched the first Health Map with Perspective, a data aggregator designed to analyze how diseases affect women and men differently. This project seeks to incorporate the gender perspective into the study of health, understanding the importance of the concepts of sex and gender in the impact and treatment of diseases.

title: Presentación del Mapa de Salud con Perspectiva
summary: Organon, a pharmaceutical company focusing on women's health, and the Gaspar Casal Foundation have initiated the Health Map with Perspective, a free, interactive online tool that consolidates various public data sources. It aims to highlight how diseases affect women and men differently by providing information on morbidity and mortality rates, along with factors such as income, employment, inequality, public health spending, and birth rates at the provincial, regional, and national levels in Spain. This tool is intended as a valuable asset for researchers, healthcare administrators, scientific societies, and governmental bodies at all levels to better understand and address sex and gender disparities in health. Additionally, the platform offers video tutorials to enhance user experience. This project was unveiled at the College of Physicians in Madrid, underscoring its capacity to facilitate the comparison of data and the assessment of women's health needs, with information sourced from official entities like the INE and the Ministry of Health.

title: El Hospital de Mollet permite a los familiares seguir el estado de los pacientes en una aplicación
summary: The Mollet Health Foundation has updated its Connecta FSM app, launched in 2023, to allow patients' relatives to follow their status at the Mollet University Hospital, the Mollet Sociosanitary, and the Mollet Mental Health and Addictions Center. The new Patient Tracking feature provides real-time information about the assigned doctor and nurse, location in emergencies, status of diagnostic tests, and, for hospitalized patients, the unit and room number. Patients can share an access code with their relatives to access the information, ensuring privacy by not disclosing test results. Users can revoke relatives' access at any time from their profile. This update improves communication and the user experience of the app.

title: Se constituye la red de hospitales C-17 de la que forman parte los de Granollers, Mollet y Sant Celoni
summary: The Health Department has established the second hospital network in Catalonia, named C-17, which includes six hospitals: Campdevànol, Sant Celoni, Mollet del Vallès, Vic, Granollers, and Clínic de Barcelona. Led by Health Minister Manel Balcells, this initiative aims to enhance collaborative work among hospitals of different levels to ensure equitable, high-quality, safe, and efficient healthcare services. The network will also focus on improving specialized care for diseases requiring high specialization or technology, including rare, oncological diseases, and precision medicine. The strategic alliance emphasizes proximity, quality, equity for citizens, and promotes teaching, research, and innovation. This network, in development since 2015, represents a significant shift in organizing the country's healthcare map, ensuring uniform healthcare standards across Catalonia. The agreement will last four years, with the possibility of extension, and follows the establishment of the first healthcare network in Girona and precedes a third in Lleida and Alt Pirineu and Aran.

title: Hospitales verdes para un futuro más sostenible
summary: The International Federation of Hospitals has recognized the environmental sustainability efforts of the Fundación Sanitaria Mollet. This acknowledgment emphasizes the growing significance of eco-friendly endeavors in the healthcare industry, targeting a more sustainable future.

title: La Generalitat autoriza la construcción de la Escuela Universitaria de Enfermería y un auditorio junto al Hospital de ...
summary: The territorial urban planning commission of the Metropolitan Arch of Barcelona has approved the expansion and improvement of various health and social care facilities in the Vallès Oriental, Occidental, and Maresme regions. Specifically, in Vallès Oriental, the construction of the University School of Nursing next to the Mollet del Vallès Hospital has been facilitated. A special urban plan was approved for a 5,600 m2 site in Mollet del Vallès, aimed at providing healthcare and social care use, enabling the establishment of the University School of Nursing of the Mollet Healthcare Foundation and a new auditorium. The project includes a building with a ground floor, two upper floors, and a basement. The commission highlighted the public interest of the action, its response to population needs, and its compliance with regulations and environmental conditions.

title: El Hospital Fundación Alcorcón recibe la visita de profesionales sanitarios de países europeos en el marco del ...
summary: The Alcorcón Foundation University Hospital, a public center of the Community of Madrid, received a visit from health professionals from various European countries as part of a program of the European Federation of Hospitals and Healthcare (HOPE) under the motto "Retaining healthcare staff". The visit was coordinated by Dr. Gil Rodríguez Caravaca, head of the Preventive Medicine Unit of the hospital and responsible for the HOPE program in the center. During the visit, the 15 participating European professionals had the opportunity to get to know the hospital facilities and attend interventions by prominent professionals from the center. This exchange program aims to improve understanding of the functioning of health systems in Europe, promote efficiency and humanity in hospital organization, and facilitate cooperation and mobility of healthcare professionals within the European Union.

title: El Hospital Fundación Alcorcón recibe la visita de profesionales sanitarios de países europeos en el marco del ...
summary: The Alcorcón Foundation University Hospital, a public center in the Community of Madrid, has been visited by healthcare professionals from several European countries. This visit is part of the program of the European Federation of Hospitals and Healthcare (HOPE), with the motto of this edition being 'Retaining healthcare staff'. The coordination of the visit and the interventions were led by Dr. Gil Rodríguez, head of the Preventive Medicine Unit at the hospital.

title: El Hospital de Alcorcón pone fin a sus goteras tras una revolución en sus cubiertas
summary: The Alcorcón Foundation University Hospital, located in the Community of Madrid and one of the largest in terms of surface area in Spain, has solved its leak problems through a comprehensive reform of its roofs. This reform not only addressed waterproofing issues but also included the installation of 900 solar panels. The hospital, which operates under a public foundation management model, opened its doors in December 1997, starting with the Rheumatology consultations and completing its opening with the Emergency service in March 1998.

title: Jornada "Lean" en el Hospital Universitario Fundación Alcorcón
summary: The Hospital Universitario Fundación Alcorcón is hosting a "Lean" event on June 21, 2024, from 9:30 AM to 2:00 PM, focusing on patient-centered healthcare. Over the years, the hospital has been implementing the "Lean" culture to create a more agile, efficient environment aimed at improving healthcare quality. Positive outcomes have been observed in various departments such as Emergency, Day Surgery, and Hospitalization. The event, organized by the hospital's Kaizen Office, aims to share and analyze "Lean" experiences within Spanish healthcare organizations and includes participation from European hospitals to gain insights into their "Lean" environments. The methodology will be discussed from different perspectives, encouraging dynamic discussions and interactions among speakers. The event targets healthcare professionals and requires email registration for attendance.

title: Los pacientes en hemodiálisis del Hospital Fundación Alcorcón mejoran su experiencia con actividades ...
summary: Patients receiving hemodialysis at Hospital Universitario Fundación Alcorcón have seen an improvement in well-being through additional activities like foot reflexology, music therapy, and art therapy, provided by the NGO Fundación Llamada Solidaria since October 2022. A study by the hospital's Dialysis Unit nurses revealed that these leisure and relaxation activities improve patients' ability to manage kidney disease and promote a sense of community among those undergoing treatment together. Foot reflexology, offered by the association De los Pies al Corazón, has been the most popular and satisfying activity, with over 540 sessions for more than 50 patients. In total, the NGO has organized over 600 sessions of various activities. This initiative aims to make hospital stays more humane and enhance the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions, rare diseases, or disabilities.

title: El Hospital Universitario Fundación Alcorcón ve reconocido su trabajo por la seguridad del paciente quirúrgico
summary: The Alcorcón Foundation University Hospital has been awarded by the patient safety association SENSAR with the awards "Proud Collaborator of SENSAR 2023" and "Active Hospital, Safe Hospital". These recognitions are due to its commitment to surgical patient safety, continuous collaboration with SENSAR since its foundation in 2009, and its system of learning from mistakes and continuous quality improvement. The hospital has been the venue for training and dissemination activities on patient safety and has participated in the SAFEST project, funded by Horizon Europe 2021, to improve surgical patient safety through the standardization of procedures. This recognition has been awarded uninterruptedly since 2018, reflecting the hospital's commitment to providing quality and safe healthcare.

title: El Hospital Fundación Alcorcón ha incorporado Inteligencia Artificial en los ámbitos de Asistencia, Investigación y ...
summary: The Alcorcón Foundation University Hospital, a public center of the Community of Madrid, has made progress in incorporating Artificial Intelligence (AI) into its processes, adding two new applications to the previous three, making a total of five. These applications are focused on improving healthcare, research, and hospital management. In the Diagnostic Imaging Unit, applications have been implemented to support diagnosis in chest and bone X-rays, improving certainty in diagnoses and speeding up work times. On the other hand, in research, a solution is used that structures clinical notes through Natural Language Processing, while in management, an application has been implemented that automatically codes healthcare activity. These tools not only optimize hospital processes but also contribute to better patient care.

title: El Hospital Fundación Alcorcón incorpora a sus pacientes como ponentes en las sesiones clínicas de profesionales
summary: The Alcorcón Foundation University Hospital, in the Community of Madrid, has incorporated patients as speakers in its clinical sessions aimed at healthcare professionals. This initiative began with a session organized by the Bariatric Surgery Unit, where two expert patients shared their experiences and knowledge on obesity treatment, marking a milestone in integrating the patient's perspective into healthcare. The goal is to enrich the training of health professionals with the direct testimony of patients, offering a more complete and humane view of the care process. This practice is part of a broader effort by the hospital to involve patients in the management of healthcare, being pioneers in creating a Patient Commission and implementing a project to incorporate the patient's voice in all the hospital's units and services.

title: Los profesionales del Hospital Fundación Alcorcón publicaron 253 artículos científicos en 2023
summary: In 2023, professionals at the Hospital Universitario Fundación Alcorcón published 253 scientific articles with a global Impact Factor of 1.164. Among these publications, 79 were featured in Q1 journals, the top 25% of scientific journals. The hospital's h-index, which measures both the productivity and citation impact of the publications, reached a new high of 107. The hospital also had 12 competitive research projects active, including one European project, and 257 active clinical studies involving medications, with 129 being clinical trials. Since 1997, the hospital has accumulated a total of 4,240 scientific publications with nearly 66,000 citations. Neurology had the highest number of publications with 27, followed by Internal Medicine and Cardiology with 26 each. The hospital awarded prizes for the most significant research projects and publications of 2023, highlighting the hospital's leading role in research among similar-sized and complexity centers.

title: El Hospital Fundación Alcorcón reúne a expertos nacionales para potenciar la cooperación al desarrollo desde el ...
summary: The Alcorcón Foundation University Hospital, a public center of the Community of Madrid, organized its I Development Cooperation Day to serve as a forum for the exchange of experiences and updating of knowledge in the field of health cooperation for development. The day featured the participation of national and international experts, including representatives from organizations such as Manos Unidas and Cáritas, and hospital professionals who addressed topics such as diseases that limit development in Africa and America, maternal and child mortality in Guatemala, cooperation in radiology in Peru, and the reduction of mortality from pneumonia in Guatemala, among others. Cooperation in surgery, health care on dangerous migratory routes, and projects for training local staff for the sustainability of cooperation efforts were also discussed. The day was structured in three sessions, including one specifically dedicated to the training and sustainability of cooperation projects.

title: El responsable de Gestión del Conocimiento del Hospital Fundación Alcorcón, nombrado vicedecano de Hospitales ...
summary: Dr. Carlos Guijarro, previously in charge of Knowledge Management at Hospital Universitario Fundación Alcorcón and a professor at Universidad Rey Juan Carlos, has been named Vice Dean of Hospitals at the Faculty of Health Sciences of the same university. This position is intended to improve the partnership between the faculty and teaching hospitals, marking the first occasion in the 25-year history of the university that a professor from a teaching hospital has been part of the faculty's leadership team. The Hospital Universitario Fundación Alcorcón, a public hospital in the Community of Madrid, is crucial to the university's health education, with five out of eight titular professors at the Faculty of Health Sciences coming from this hospital. These professors, along with honorary collaborators, play a key role in the outstanding achievements of URJC's medical students in the national MIR exams, showcasing the hospital's strong commitment to education.

title: El Hospital Fundación Alcorcón obtiene la certificación de calidad 'Q-PEX' por su atención farmacéutica a pacientes ...
summary: The Alcorcón University Hospital Foundation, a public center of the Community of Madrid, has received the 'Q-PEX' certification for its pharmaceutical care to outpatients, awarded by the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy. This certification, a pioneer at the international level, evaluates 118 indicators in areas such as planning, resource management, research, innovation, and improvement of care for the outpatient in hospital pharmacy. In 2023, the Pharmacy Area of the hospital made more than 25,000 dispensations to more than 5,300 outpatients, including about 450 attended via telematics with home medication delivery. The 'Q-PEX' certification supports continuous improvement and management of excellence, focusing on pharmaceutical care to the outpatient, an area of growing relevance due to the increase in outpatients caused by the aging of the population and the chronicity of pathologies.

title: Campaña en Alicante: #Elige Medicina de Familia. No te defraudará'
summary: The Valencian Society of Family and Community Medicine (SoVaMFiC) has launched a campaign called #Choose Family Medicine to attract students to this medical specialty, especially in the context of the MIR selection, where there is concern about its labor appeal. The campaign includes informative sessions at the Miguel Hernández University to highlight the importance and values of family medicine, as well as its fundamental role in the Spanish health system. Additionally, the II Congress of Residents, Tutors, and Medicine Students is mentioned, which seeks to foster interest in this area. The initiative highlights the challenges and satisfactions of family medicine, focusing on its impact on people's lives and community health.

title: Cecilia Vecillas, pediatra en Oleiros durante 30 años, reconocida por el Colegio Médico de A Coruña
summary: Cecilia Vecillas, a retired pediatrician who served in Oleiros for over thirty years, has been awarded the Gold Medal with Diamonds by the Official College of Physicians of A Coruña. This recognition comes as a result of her dedication to disease prevention, health promotion, her altruistic approach to patient care, and her solidarity spirit. Vecillas, who comes from a farming family and is the third of eight siblings, pursued her medical studies through scholarships, graduating from the University of Oviedo. She began her career in Ponteareas in 1980 before moving to Oleiros. Her commitment to her patients made her a beloved figure in the community, which was highlighted by a massive tribute from the town and the municipality of Oleiros in 2016. Vecillas is a staunch advocate for vaccination and public health, with a significant part of her career dedicated to volunteering in international campaigns across Peru, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Mexico. She emphasizes the importance of a well-rounded education for medical professionals, combining technical knowledge with humanistic and bioethical training. Vecillas views the recognition as an honor, though she humbly believes she simply fulfilled her duties.

title: La pediatra Cecilia Vecillas Sevilla, Medalla de Oro y Brillantes del Colegio de Médicos de A Coruña
summary: Cecilia Vecillas Sevilla, a retired pediatrician from Oleiros, has been awarded the Gold and Diamond Medal by the Official College of Physicians of A Coruña. This recognition comes as a result of her over thirty years of dedicated service in Oleiros, where she was celebrated for her commitment to disease prevention, health promotion, and her altruistic and solidary spirit. Vecillas, who comes from a family of farmers and pursued her studies through scholarships, has been an advocate for vaccination and public health measures that significantly reduce infant mortality. Besides her professional career, she has also been involved in international volunteer work in countries like Peru, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Mexico, focusing on combating child malnutrition. Vecillas believes in the importance of a humanistic and bioethical formation for medical professionals, beyond technical knowledge, to serve the community effectively. The medal will be presented to her at the XVI Medical Meeting at the Paraninfo of the Universidade da Coruña.

title: DKV y el Colegio Oficial de Médicos de A Coruña firman un acuerdo de colaboración
summary: DKV has signed a collaboration agreement with the Colegio Oficial de Médicos de A Coruña (COMC), aiming to enhance the relationship and cooperation with healthcare professionals. The agreement, valid for the next three years, was signed by Dr. Francisco Juan, DKV's Director General of Health, and representatives from COMC. It includes health, dental, and income insurance policies for registered doctors, collaboration in college events and DKV's Medicine and Solidarity Awards, and the organization of informational events for medical specialists' career opportunities. Additionally, it grants COMC members access to DKV's telemedicine platform, Quiero cuidarme Más, and involves collaboration in organizing the next edition of the Medicine and Solidarity Awards, which honor individuals and entities in the healthcare sector who contribute to societal change through solidarity projects. This partnership reflects DKV's strategic plan to strengthen trust and collaboration with healthcare professionals, prioritizing quality care and mutual trust.

title: Foro sobre Ciudades que cuidan, en el Colegio de Médicos de A Coruña
summary: The Official College of Physicians of A Coruña is organizing a forum on caring and compassionate cities on April 15, in collaboration with the Archbishopric of Santiago. The event, which will take place from 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM, aims to promote a structural change in society in response to the challenge of unwanted loneliness, considered a social and public health problem. Various professionals will participate, including the president of the College of Physicians of A Coruña, Luciano Vidán Martínez, and the Archbishop of Santiago, Francisco José Prieto. Topics such as care as a political value, the Bidasoa Zurekin Comarca Compasiva project to accompany people with advanced diseases, home hospitalization, palliative care, assistance support in residences, and compassion in care will be discussed. Admission is free until full capacity is reached.

title: DKV y el Colegio Oficial de Médicos de A Coruña firman un acuerdo de colaboración
summary: DKV has signed a collaboration agreement with the Official College of Physicians of A Coruña (COMC), aiming to enhance the relationship and collaboration with healthcare professionals. The agreement, valid for the next three years, includes health, dental, and income insurance policies for registered doctors, collaboration in College events and awards, and the organization of events for potential professional opportunities for medical specialists. DKV is committed to strengthening the trust relationship with healthcare professionals through strategic planning, including giving access to the DKV telemedicine platform "Quiero cuidarme Más" and collaborating in the organization of the next edition of the DKV Medicine and Solidarity Awards. This initiative honors individuals and entities in the healthcare sector who support or promote solidarity projects while performing their professional duties. DKV's efforts reflect its continuous commitment to excellence and service improvement in healthcare.

title: El Colegio de Médicos de A Coruña acoge el viernes un encuentro sobre asistencia compartida
summary: The Official College of Physicians of A Coruña will organize on April 19 the II Meeting of the shared assistance and interconsultation group of the Galician Society of Internal Medicine, focused on collaboration between surgeons and internists for major abdominal surgery, including colon and hepatobiliary-pancreatic surgery. The meeting, coordinated by Dr. Héctor Meijide, head of the Internal Medicine Service at the Quirónsalud Hospital A Coruña, promotes teamwork to improve the recovery of patients, especially those of older age and complexity. Preoperative strategies such as anemia, nutrition, and exercise will be discussed, with the participation of specialists from various fields, to better prepare patients for surgery and promote a faster and more effective recovery.

title: El Colegio de Médicos de A Coruña acoge hoy una jornada sobre los cuidados y el futuro de las ciudades
summary: The College of Physicians of A Coruña hosts today a conference titled "Cities that care, compassionate cities", organized in collaboration with the Pablo VI Foundation and the Archbishopric of Santiago. The conference, which starts at 4:00 p.m., seeks to reflect on how to build more solidary societies in a context of population aging, chronic diseases, and weakening of the sense of community. José Ramón Amor Pan, academic director of the Pablo VI Foundation, emphasizes the importance of not following care models based on technology, such as the use of robots for elder care in Japan, and advocates for a society that does not leave any citizen behind. The event will include talks from experts and the presentation of successful practical cases.

title: La factura rampante del hospital Fundación Jiménez Díaz: el coste para la sanidad pública madrileña sube un 26% en siete años
summary: The invoice from the Hospital Fundación Jiménez Díaz, which belongs to the Quirónsalud group and works for the public health service of Madrid, has increased by 26% between 2011 and 2017, going from 327.1 million euros to 413.5 million. This increase is partly due to a higher number of outpatients from its area of influence, attracted by the free choice system and an expansion of the service portfolio. Despite having fewer beds and staff compared to hospitals like La Paz, Gregorio Marañón, and 12 de Octubre, its cost has matched these due to its focus on outpatient care and high-profitability procedures. This financing model has been questioned for its high cost compared to public management hospitals and for favoring private hospitals integrated into the public system, creating distortions in competition and resource management.

title: La sanidad madrileña recoge sus 18 Placas BiC en recompensa de su "altísimo nivel y talento de sus profesionales"
summary: The Madrid health system was awarded 18 of the 39 Best in Class (BiC) Awards in recognition of its excellence and quality in patient care, being the region with the most distinctions and having 63 finalists. The BiC Plaques ceremony took place on April 15 at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital, highlighting the extremely high level and talent of Madrid's health professionals. The Minister of Health, Fátima Matute, reaffirmed the commitment of the Community of Madrid to a health system of excellence, emphasizing the importance of prevention and innovation in the sector. Achievements such as leading life expectancy in Europe, having the lowest waiting lists, and making progress in areas such as biomedical research and CAR-T therapies were highlighted. Matute emphasized the need to adapt to future challenges such as population aging and chronic diseases, relying on the professionalism and dedication of Madrid's health personnel.

title: La Comunidad de Madrid publica por primera vez su auditoría anual de la actividad que debe pagarle al Hospital Fundación Jiménez Díaz
summary: The Community of Madrid has published for the first time an annual audit on the economic activity related to the Hospital Fundación Jiménez Díaz, belonging to the Quirónsalud Group, revealing services from 2017 not performed, incorrectly categorized, or duplicated. This report, which seeks to verify the truthfulness of services financed with public funds, stands out as a step towards transparency in a context where the management of hospitals by third parties has been criticized for its opacity. The audit shows discrepancies in the classification of services and detects duplications and services not performed, which has significant economic implications for public coffers. This effort to increase transparency comes at a time when the private management of public hospitals, and their supervision, has been a topic of debate in Madrid.

title: El Colegio Oficial de Farmacéuticos de Zaragoza pone en marcha los actos para conmemorar su 125 aniversario
summary: The Official College of Pharmacists of Zaragoza has launched a series of celebratory events for its 125th anniversary, targeting both professionals in pharmacy and the wider public. The kickoff, aligning with the 125th anniversary of the Royal Decree founding Provincial Colleges, featured speeches by College president Raquel García and Jesús Aguilar, president of the General Council of Colleges of Pharmacists in Spain. They emphasized the College's dedication to service, its regulatory role in the profession to protect citizens' rights and ensure service quality, and its cooperation with government bodies and patient groups to enhance health. The festivities include public lectures on subjects such as artificial intelligence, vaccine skepticism, and the portrayal of science in movies, highlighting the profession's dedication to health and societal advancement through innovation.

title: El Hospital Universitario Central de la Cruz Roja, doblemente premiado en el Congreso Nacional de Geriatría
summary: The Central University Hospital of the Red Cross has been doubly awarded at the National Congress of the Spanish Society of Geriatrics and Gerontology (SEGG), held in Pamplona. The first prize, Pañellas Casas, was awarded to research on the benefits of a multicomponent exercise outpatient program for older patients with physical frailty, which showed positive results in reversing frailty and improving quality of life. The second prize, Beltrán Baguena, recognized a study on cardiac complications in geriatric patients hospitalized for COVID-19, highlighting a high incidence of cardiovascular complications, prolonged hospital stays, and higher mortality. Both research projects underline the hospital's commitment to improving geriatric care and managing complications in vulnerable populations.

title: Un proyecto en El Vergel y en Santo Domingo permite a personas mayores dejar la residencia y vivir en comunidad
summary: A project in El Vergel and Santo Domingo is allowing elderly individuals to leave their nursing homes and live in a community setting. This initiative, called "Live Better at Home," is backed by the Spanish Society of Geriatrics and Gerontology and the Spanish Confederation of Older Persons' Organizations. It started with a €2.699.034 grant from the European Next Generation funds and is being implemented in Navarra and Catalonia with different approaches. In Navarra, the focus is on providing alternatives for seniors to leave institutional care, while Catalonia aims to prevent institutionalization by enhancing at-home support services. The project aims to offer the necessary community support to seniors who wish to return to their neighborhoods, thereby integrating them as active citizens. Four out of twenty-five selected individuals from a pool of 188 residents in both centers are already transitioning to this new living arrangement.

title: UN CONGRESO PARA DISEÑAR UN NUEVO FUTURO, CONSTRUIR REDES Y TRABAJAR JUNTOS
summary: The Spanish Society of Geriatrics and Gerontology (SEGG) will organize its 64th annual congress in Málaga in June 2024, coinciding with the 44th congress of the Andalusian Society of Geriatrics and Gerontology. This event is especially significant due to the official recognition of geriatrics as a medical specialty by the Andalusian Health Service.
